this felt like a cheap anime version of 50 shades of grey, except with shittier character and development.

At first glance you might think that this is a another "High School Romance", and at first it is, but this anime goes somewhere that others don't. Most series end when the characters are still in high school, but Itazura na Kiss goes past high school, into college and even into life after that. This series is truely something of a masterpiece in character develpment.
The story line is the classic love story with a small twist, of course I won't go into detail, you'll have to see for yourself! The music kind of reminded me a lot of the same in different animes, but stillit catchy and if there is ever a chance to get my hands on the soundtrack, I certianly will!


Unless you get really into your anime, you might not feel the deep feelings that the characters have. When Kotoko cried, I cried. When she laughed, I smiled and laughed with her. When she made a complete fool of herself ... I laughed at her. But when I watch shows, I get pulled into them. So when I watched each episode, there were partes that I cried, both in sadness and happiness.


So if you're looking for an anime with the same ol' story but a different twist and something a little more, Itazura na Kiss is a series you should look into. I enjoyed every minute of it and I know many more people will too.



Thank you Tada Kaoru for giving the world such amazing stories.

This is my second review, so don't expect too much =)
This is the second shoujo I watched...after dropping Kaichou wa Maid-Sama! I decided to try another shoujo to see if I really have a problem with shoujo anime, and I think yes, I don't like shoujo animes.
Itazura na Kiss is really funny and I was marathoning it, until something happens in ep 14 and I was like WHAT THE HELL JUST HAPPENED?!?!? It was way to fast and I didn't see it coming. After this I decided to watch one more episode and then even though it was still funny I was like "I don'tcare for what is happening from now on" so I dropped AGAIN.


The thing is I don't like the male-lead character (He is too perfect, and too boring), so I wanted Kotoko to stay with any other guy that liked her instead of Irie. I was expecting her to grow up and change her behaviour. But forget it, you are not goint to see any kind of development in her and his character. It is just ridiculous.


This anime is based in a manga written in 1990, so a lot of concepts about relationships changed since the manga was written. And I understand it, but it was unbearable to me (because Kotoko was so dependent of Irie and she didn't have any creative ideas on her own, she is just following him around...). So I dropped in ep 15 and I don't regret. 


My grade is 6 because I enjoyed the ending song hahah and because first episodes were really nice/funny and I had hope that the story was going to develop to something better.

This is my first review however I loved this show. Being a romantic this show pulled at my heart and made it impossible not to rewatch. The story is that a girl who is in class F has had a crush on a guy since 8th grade however he is in class A and a jerk. The story goes on with the girl never giving up on her crush. I loved this show and recommend it to any shoujo romance fans as it breaks barriers. This show is very different as it focuses on the pain of love and not automatically just in love.

I was sceptical about this when it first was airred, I thought it was another high school life anime, but I was wrong suprisingly, and I enjoyed it alot, I loved how the characters are slowly developed, and how the two characters come to be, it was interesting to see how one influenced the other, and generally it was just lovely to watch, its funny, and entertaining yet at the same time can be quite emotional.
Overall I enjoyed it, and I am looking forward to reading the manga.

Itazura na kiss is in my opinion a girly anime. Its a good romace anime with the parts a normal girl would enjoy watching. Its about a girl trying to win over the love of a boy who doesnt love her, atleast thats what he claims. The part i enjoyed the most from this anime is how she step by step got through to him, she made herself get accepted by him. The girl in this anime is kind,stubborn and not that smart. The boy in this anime is very smart and has a stubborn and kinda mean character, which makes it harder to approachhim. The boy annoys the girl alot, what I really enjoy seeing. I gave the storyline a 8 because the storyline was so interesting I just couldnt stop watching. I was so curious about how the anime would end that I watched it all in 1 day. The art wasnt that bad, it actually fits the anime perfectly. Both protagonist have an unique character just the opposite of each other, which makes their relation a bit complicated. You can cleary see the jealousy they feel to each other, even if they try to hide it. The story gets completed by adding funny parts along the romace parts, it makes the story easier to watch without getting tired. I enjoyed myself thoroughly while watching which is why i gave the story an overal score of 8.

I happened to stumble upon this little pearl of an anime while browsing for something new to watch. Even though the recommendations were very positive, I was a little bit hesitant due to the possibility of yet another shojo with identical plot and storyline - but boy, was I surprised :) And pleasantly so, no less. Sure, in general "Itazura na kiss" isn't that inventive - most components of a classic "boy and girl meet, go through a struggle of some kind, and end up happy"-shojo, but there's just something in the way the story is told, that is too compelling to not make youengrossed by this anime. And that actually says pretty much since I am a cynical person and get very bugged over sugarcoated sugar mixed with sugar, which usually is the case with a lot of shojos. I like Kare Kano, Hana Kimi, Hot Gimmick and a few other shojos, but generally I tend to avoid them since they don't give me very much. (Sure, I have a couple of exceptions like "Ouran" and Fruits basket - which are kind of silly - but I like 'em anyway.) I tend to stick to other types of anime and manga, but a well told love story is kind of universal and should be recognizable for anyone. 


This is hilarious and entertaining at the same time as it's romantic and serious. The weird thing is that it actually even pulls it off. But I say as another viewer mentioned in a recommendation somewhere - what's up with all the excessive ER-visits? Boy, are they prone to illness and accidents in the Irie-family... Also I wonder what makes that baka girl so extremely attractive to all guys out there in her world... She IS, as Naoki says - annoying, loud, stupid and silly... 

Sometimes, the story takes a pretty slow pace and becomes slightly repetative, but it doesn't really bother, it kind of stresses the fact that "Itazura na kiss" actually spans a long period of time. This isn't really the kind of anime with cliffhangers or made to make you bite your fingernails. This is more of a story about two people that go through a lot to end up together, and it's a pure joy to follow them along the way :)


Kotoko is one of the most embarrassing idiots I've ran across in any manga/anime, but she is a very sweet idiot :) Naoki makes me swoon as the stupid tsundere moe I am (ah - we always fall for it - such a victory to cure the evil and bring forth the inner softness of a jerk... but hey, news flash... some of the jerks are actually jerks even deep inside...) 

Actually, I like all the characters. Kinnosuke, who was extremely annoying in the beginning, kind of harrassed himself into my heart pretty fast, and he would probably be my favourite character of the cast :) And also, I personally love Jinko, although a lot of folks seem to find her annoying - her insanely horrible voice and weird personality makes me laugh :)

I also can't help but to love Naoki's mom - she is too absurd not to adore. Also the brat Yuuki - the younger brother in the Irie family - is a pretty strong character, important for the whole picture :)


The art and style is pretty much standard - same flaws as in many other anime, but it holds a pretty high standard with easily recognizable characters and carefully drawn surroundings - it's not sloppy work, and that's important at least for me (who draw a lot myself). Both the art and style changes and enhances a little bit towards the end, but the change is not detectable in the looks of characters and such, only that it seems a bit cleaner and brighter, characters more carefully shaped. 


All in all it's a great series - making one happy and cheerful, there fore the very consistent and high score. Really a little pearl among the oceans of crappy standard cut shojo. Sure, "Itazura na kiss" is very classic in it's storyline - but the author of the original manga really has managed to create some depth to the story, and I am happy I gave this series a chance :) It was definitely worth it. Also, I would say that I agree with all the guys I've seen praising this series are absolutely right - this isn't classic shojo in THAT sense - purely for girls - but rather this is bound to entertain any fan of anime, no matter gender or age. (Except for that it's too emotionally mature for younger kids than say, 14.) But watch it! You won't regret it :)

Story: It was really quite a story. I think the plot progressed at just the right pace. It does linger on Kotoko's unrequited love, but they do it tastefully. Of course, it was quite predictable since they do end up together (no shocker there). But feminists, BEWARE!
Art: I liked the art style, but I don't think there was anything absolutely amazing to it, then again, I'm not much of an expert on that and I certainly don't know what to look for in this category. Most of the characters were pleasing to the eye, though. Oh, but there is the fact that, physically, most ofthe characters don't seem to change, except for Non-chan and Naoki's little brother. They do address this, though, when the police in Hawaii stops Kotoko and mentions how he thought she was an elementary school girl.


Sound: I would have given it a ten, UNTIL I heard them speak English. It was truly embarrassing, it all honesty. I adored the music they featured, but again, the way they spoke English was a real turnoff.


Character: I really don't like that I had to give a ten to the characters. They were round and quite well developed, I think, but as mentioned above, you can tell how anti-feminist the whole show is. I really angered me, but I can't lie, I enjoyed the show. Almost all the girls in a relationship are slapped across the face at least once. I'm quite tired of anime always showing a girl in love with her superiors (money wise, I understand, funny enough, but intellectually? I'm sorry but men are no match the most women when it comes to brains. Also, what is wrong with Kotoko? Crawling after some guy? And when they're married, he get's angry at her she excuses it with "it was my fault." And Chris does the same thing, but she degrades herself in order to follow that guy. I would never give a guy the light of day if they didn't already like me, and even if they did, I probably won't like them either. However, you do grow attached to the characters. The predicament is quite believable, after all. I know many a smart men and women who end up married with someone with no intelligence (only difference is that Kotoko remains loving and faithful, which I respect.)


Enjoyment: Like I said, it was credible. This Shoujo actually evolves into a Slice of Life anime, though towards the end, I think it resembles the Novelas I secretly watch sometimes. This is quite a show for someone who wants to let go of reality for a while, though it is believable, I sincerely believe a relationship like that would never last long. But it was cute after all--just like reading about magic; it's not real, but you can still dream about it =)

This anime starts with a bang. The nervous jittery confession of a not so genius student to the highest scoring high school student in Japan. But her quite passionate love letter is greeted with a definite no in a highly rude manner. Only to come home to a tumbled heap of a house after a slight earth quake jiggled Tokyo, The girl is subjected to another heart renching tragedy. The young girl and her father are welcomed to stay with her fathers old middle school friends to find that the genius boy is the eldest son! The two don't get along. In fact the boyrefuses to chat with her and even watches the train doors close in her face as she is left to be late for school. He explains coldly that he hates stupid absent minded girls. The rejection is so absolute it is embarrassing. But on one episode later he clams he could love her and even starts talking with her at school. From the beginning I sensed this anime would have a wonderfully dramatic story of how this unsuspecting and highly unlikely couple would come to be, but I was horribly annoyed and quite sad to find that this was not the case at all. This anime has let me down. I was looking for something much more startling like a life dangering drama that would bring to completely different souls into a heart changing decision. But evidently this completely unbelievable couple is inspired only after a couple days of study and a little blackmail!!! ... Disappointed. :(   I understand that I've only just started watching this, and my currentopinion is likly to change, but I was just so appalled  I needed to get this tragedy off my chest.

I'm going to say this right now: I don't like romance shows that involve verbal abuse. I don't like it when the female character is constantly being shut down by the male character because he's stubborn, and that is exactly what was portrayed throughout this show. 
Naoki was a huge jerk the entire anime to Kotoko. I know there was some instances like when it was her birthday or when she was in the hospital where he really showed that he loved her, but that was a side of him that you rarely get to see. He never paid attention to Kotoko or helped her withher studies when she was trying to earn good grades and impress him. \n\n
I got severely annoyed a lot throughout this anime with his negative attitude. Don't get me wrong, it was a good anime to watch and there was a lot of funny parts to it. I was just expecting Naoki to change once he married Kotoko, but it didn't happen so I was a little disappointed.

He! Abuses! Her!  
I don't think I need to say much more... this anime was ruined by the fact that the main love interest is a complete jerk to the MC!  Even after he marries her he neglects her, abuses her, doesn't give her freedom of any kind.... it's a terrible relationship and not one that viewers should idolize. Throughout the entire anime he is rude to her and ignores her, never treating her with respect, sympathy, or love.   It's sad to watch this girl fall madly in love with this guy who treats her so dreadfully.  - in laterepisodes- Every attempt she makes to escape him is blocked by his family, her family, or himself.  She doesn't even have the opportunity to leave the relationship!!  Not only does he emotionally abuse her- he physically abuses her too!!! Dude! what- you- no! you can't do that and then act like it's no big deal! You just smacked this girl who is in love with you and you're like "yeah she deserved that lol she's never gonna stop loving me hahah".  This guy is a jerk and i hate this abusive anime.

*Spoilers may slip in but I will try to be vague*
I think I wanted to like this anime too much so I did go into this one with very high hopes. 
Overall the story is generic its been done many times before however I had heard really good things about this one.  I enjoyed moments of the anime and if you are struggling to find something to watch. I recommend it as filler. But do not go into it with high expectations or if you have just watched a strong romance anime like *say I love you*.
Straight of the bat the characters really annoyedme.

Kotoko has a crush on the smartest boy in the school ( generic right) shes clumsy and the polar opposite to him. However her feelings are posed as love... even though its stated their classrooms are very far apart. And Naoki cold shoulders anyone he deems not smart enough.

Her clumsyness is played up so much it really bugged me and I started to predict how the episodes would unfold. And once that happens I get bored very very fast. 


Naoki annoyed me the most, I get wanting to make your character slightly unlikable. But he is flat out rude, and often or not makes a mockery of the MC. On occasions I felt it went too far. He is played of as cold but its problematic if I find myself routing for a relationship with the sub characters and the MC. His nice points are so subtle that when they do eventually get together its confusing and a shock. 

 I felt myself trying too hard to see good in the character because I wanted the two of them to work. I also kept hoping his character would soften up and it does....2 episodes towards the end....

His character also seems to get worst at times making him a complete asshat.  There is an episode where he slaps the MC. In a romance anime thats something that just flat out ruined it. Theres no call for violence even when someone is upset. He flat out treat her coldly even after they get married. And get annoyed when other men want to treat her right ...even though she has to bear him flirting with other characters or even considering snap marriage interviews. The  balance of give and take in their relationship is very one sided. At no point in the anime did I feel like rooting for the two...And I love romance animes I enjoy seeing two characters come together. By the end of this I wanted to re-watch a better anime and forget my wasted day.

His character is often shunted along whenever the plot determines its appropriate.

The character takes a complete 180 as he reveals he wants to marry the MC. Even though up to this point there is very little relationship development between them. 

The side character do not do much for me. They definately do not save the plot either. 

Naokis brother is your generic moody over judgmental kid. The one who picks on the MC and is usually very arrogant themselves. 

Kinnosuke I felt sorry for he loved the MC since they were childhood friends. But hes used as comic relief or when the plot calls for it. He is a plot device to get the characters to realise they want to be with one another. 


The biggest sin in this anime is its Engrish....if I had to sin just one thing its the episode where two of out characters speak...very very bad Engrish. So much so I was yelling at the screen for them to speak Japanese. 

Our American character is so poor at Engrish it just irritated me throughout the episode. Its also the episode where our Naoki decides to announce hes going to marry this girl because he likes her...Saying that knowing the MC is in earshot. And then he gets angry because her childhood friend proposes to her. 

The plot is very childish at times. Its a case of .... AND THEN..... AND THENNNNNNN. o.o but that may make no sense.


Everything feels so forced and rushed. It also gave the impression the anime wanted to be a high school romance up until it got ahead of itself and started hurdling forward. Which moves me to the plot...


The plot is generic and I have no complaints for that, many of the anime I enjoy have standard plots. The thing I took issue with was the pacing. Outright it seemed like the plot was being rushed very quickly. This may be due to the amount of manga there is. I have not read it or even checked. Because as an anime it should stand on its own without having to read the manga. For me I pick up mangas when the anime has done such a good job I want more. 

Maybe the anime was rushed? maybe they wanted to get to the good bits and cut out the fluff. But it needed the fluff this time around. A bit more time on actually developing feelings between the two would of helped. Or even letting us into Naokis thought process, that would of perhaps lightened my hatred towards him.

The plot starts quickly, hits a U turn and full speed bolts to the finish. 

Often of not I found myself getting confused as to what had happened and how much time had passed between events. One moment shes 17 the next shes 26. And all that happens in 25 episodes of non stop rushing.

The anime starts as a high school romance but turns into a marriage gone wrong with hospital drama threw in.


Sound wise I think I was too mad to pay much attention to it, it did not really stand out.

The art style to is ok its nothing special. But I can forgive that if the plot or characters make up for that...but in this case they do not. 


I do recommend checking it out if you get bored or are waiting for the new season to start. But do bear in mind its a very rushed anime which leaves characters feeling stocky and generic...or just rude.

Get ready for one of the shortest reviews you've ever seen. If this show was amazing or hideous, I'd probably write more. Surprisingly (because the shounen genre terrifies me), it's perfectly mediocre.
In fact, that's probably the best way to describe it: "perfectly mediocre." Personally, I needed something like this to recover from an incredibly depressing show, which will remain unnamed for the purpose of maintaining proper etiquette.
If you're looking for something that has a decent plot, lovable characters, and some heartwarming moments- Itazura na Kiss might be perfect for you.
If you're looking for an artistic masterpiece full of high quality art, breathtaking musical scores, anda dynamic cast of controversial characters- you'd be better off trying headphones in the media department of your local WalMart.\n\n

Major spoilers. Beware.
ART - 7
The art of the anime is not really important the main thing is the story I know but I didn't really like the art. Some moments were animated badly and some moments were good. But I got used to the art.
SOUND - 8
The opening was nice but I didn't really like the ending but it's my personal opinion.
STORY & CHARACTERS - 8
A girl fell in love with a guy and tries to give him a love letter and the boy rejected him. Somehow happened that this girl's house was destroyed and the girl and her father have to live with father'sgood friend. And when they went to that house it happened that that good friend's son was the boy that rejected her. (The boy - Naoki Irie, The girl - Kotoko Aihara)\n
Irie keeps rejecting Kotoko. While she still confess her love for him. Naoki is cold like an ice or even colder and likes to say mean things. He has made Kotoko cry million times. We didn't see that he loved her until episode 14. When he proposed to her and they got married but he still continued to be like an ice. I like the cold,bad boy anime characters but not the ones like him. But when she finally got pregnant after 4 years he really changed. He was really overprotective of Kotoko but really didn't show it. He didn't like to show his emotions. But when she was pregnant he started to show them and became kinder towards her.\n
 I didn't really like their love story but the main thing I liked was the change of Irie. It showed us how love can change people.\n
I loved the moments with Noriko (mother of Irie). OHGOD she was so funny. I loved her.\n
Also I loved to see how other characters got married and have their happy life.\n
Enjoyment - 8\n
Even though I didn't like many things about this anime I still enjoyed it. I couldn't say that it was the best romance anime I have ever seen but it wasn't that bad. \n\n
- sorry for bad english -

I don't usually write reviews for anime, but Itazura na Kiss was one anime that deserved one. I am a big fan of shoujo anime, and this is one of my favorites - if not THE favorite. 
At the beginning, it looked like one typical comedy romance anime - the main character gets rejected by her beloved, that deeply despises her, but fate unites them. The characters' crazy family and friends help to make the story light and enjoyable, while the unilateral romance between Kotoko and Irie makes you want for more. Until episode 14, l was mildly enjoying it - the story was toosimilar to a lot of the ones l had watched - but it wasn't even my priority to watch it - l took almost a month to complete the series. But this anime is different from almost all shoujo anime that l had watched, for it continues after the "happy ever after". When almost all the other anime would end - with their love finally blooming, with the kiss, with the mutual confessions - this one continues. This anime shows what everyone imagines and wants to know after a good shoujo anime - what happened to the characters? Did their relationship work? Did they get married? Do they have kids? - what turned my mildly interest into an obsession to get to the end. l obviously recommend it, for it made me laugh and cry and feel that anything is possible if you fight for it - as Kotoko is a disaster at everything she does and gets rejected by Irie over and over again and still never gives up and gets to achieve everything she desired. If you are a fan of shoujo anime, this is one you shouldn't miss. \n

This anime i thought was going to really cheesy and a comedy but Itazura na Kiss was a complete shocker. Instead of the girl and guy falling in love and having a happy ever after life the plot twists and turns until you finally think everything is perfect the the anime turns into a slice of life story. At first i thought Irie Naoki was a complete jerk and i thought Kotoko was a complete idiot for falling for him. But after a couple of episodes i start to like Naoki. * don't read if you haven't finished the anime* After they got married ifinally realized how perfect they were together and altogether i thought this anime was outstanding!

When it comes to romance in any form of entertainment I consume usually I meet it with a slight shrug. I'm in different to television or movie romantic comedies. However, when it comes to anime I have a massive soft spot. I love all the cheesiness, the characters, I even enjoy - to an extent - the cliches which come with it.
Itazura seemed to be right up my ally. The underdog story shown at the start is really what drew me in. I enjoy watching someone whose at the bottom rise up and disprove those who didn't believe in them. Kotoko someone who I reallywanted to see become better than how everyone seen her. I wanted her to win. I wanted her to succeed. 


Boy was I let down. 


Story: 5


Itazura na Kiss's story is pretty basic. Kotoko is a young teenage girl who no one expects to become anything great. Irie, however, is on the other end of that spectrum, he's the most popular boy in school, gets good grades and comes from a very well off family. As with most romantic shows of this nature, naturally Kotoko is in love with him. After mustering up the courage to confess her love to Irie, Kotoko is met with a very mean rejection. Things get even more messy as Kotoko's father ends up having his house destroyed and the two have no other choice but to live with the Irie family. 


The story doesn't really have much going for it. It's basic and very, very cliched - to the point where hardly I could stomach it. The only good thing about it is the time skips. We see our two main characters go from high school to college and finally into their careers. The characters themselves aren't worth much either.


Characters: 3


While, at the start, I kind of respected Kotoko by the end of the show I was down right annoyed by her. She's very driven and hard working but as all of the standard romantic comedy tropes. She's clumsy and is a massive air-head who is constantly the butt of a joke. The show seems to enjoy making Kotoko's life down right miserable at times. When she does end up with her 'one true love' he ends up being one of the meanest people to her. I kept hoping that she'd snap out of her school girl crush and see that she could do so much better. Her only personality seems to come from being Irie's love interest. She cares only for Irie, even if it hurts her to do so. 


I hated how the show treated her and I hated that she kept letting it happen. Even when other characters were introduced, who clearly had strong feelings for her and were much better suited for her than Irie all she would do was stick by Irie. 


Irie himself is one of the worst elements of this show. I kept hoping he would finally see how amazing Kotoko was for him but all he seemed to do was find her annoying. It seemed as if he didn't care about her and all I wanted him to do was just leave her so Kotoko could run off and be happier with someone else. As the show went on I saw hints of a softer side to him but those moments were few and only really happened towards the end when Kotoko 'needed saving'.


Irie's parents were actually very nice and I couldn't fathom how they could have created such a monster. Nor could I believe that Kotoko's father would let someone like Irie take advantage of his own child. 


The few side characters we spend time with are okay. There's actually a transwoman in this show who I really enjoyed seeing and I wish I could have seen more of. 


Art: 4


At times this art-style looked down right ugly. Especially when it came to side shots of a characters face, I couldn't help but wonder why everyone thought Irie was so handsome. The character designs themselves were pretty bland and generic with no one really standing out.


Sound: 3


It's there if only to fill the need for sound. The opening and ending themes I don't even remember and were ones I always skipped.


Enjoyment: 4


If you're looking for a show with all the basic elements of a romantic comedy then Itazura na Kiss has you covered. However, there are much better shows than this one. At times I down right hated this show and how they treated Kotoko in particular. For days I left this show and only watched it in small clumps just because I kept praying that Kotoko would move on from this horrible person. Kotoko deserved way better.

Loved the Anime. It's a must watch for any anime fan. I surely didnt expect it to turn out to be such a cute anime :) I am not really a fan of romantic anime but this one is exceptional. The art is simple yet great! And the characters! Oh my God I enjoyed watching each and every character of this anime. It was hilarious at times and very emotional too. All in all it's just completely worth watching. 
Irie-kun & Kotoko-chan

This anime is the first anime I will be writing a review on. I have to say that Itazura na Kiss is the best non action anime I have ever seen. At first I was not so sure if it was good enough but once I started to watch it, I began falling in love with the anime. The plot is great. Each episode has its own little story and they manage to keep the viewer occupied. It keeps the watcher wanting for more and more after each episode. Overall its a great anime.

I never wrote a single review but this anime is so good I decided to do it.
Itazura na kiss is a fine example of a shoujo anime, It tells a story about a girl named Aihara Kotoko who didn't give up on her love Irie Naoki even when she was rejected in front of the whole school. And diffrently then most anime the guy in question Irie doesn't show that he's in love with Kotoko, but keeps trying to keep Kotoko by his side even though he doesn't want to accept her feelings. When does Irie fall in love with Kotoko is a big questioncuz you can see a little of his affection from the beginning of the anime.  This anime leaves you wanting for more and the comedy is good and not over the top like usually...  And the hole story is outstanding, the art in the middle of the anime gets a little worse but doesn't hinder the enjoyment of watching the anime, the soundtrack is great too (I myself love it :D), the characters are interesting especially Irie and Kotoko. If you hadn't seen it yet I recommend watching it!

Itazura na Kiss is, quite simply, a rather generic seeming comedic drama. The basic scenario of the plot has a rather basic structure that is, more or less, rather predictable. It's about a high school girl who is infatuated with a boy who doesn't seem to care for her whatsoever but by some mysterious twist of fate ends up living in his house due to unfortunate circumstances and the development of both the male and female protagonists. Nonetheless, Itazura na Kiss was still rather gripping and kept me peeled to the screen (I marathon-ed through it >___>) until the end. 
Story: 7
As mentioned above, thestory plot-line was, for the most part rather predictable and seemed to have a lot of reoccurring instances (the most noticeable being Irie's popularity and other men chasing Kotoko). There were also a few lulls in the series and then a number of rushed scenes which left more to be desired on the part of the director. It was still enjoyable and it worked rather well for the most part in forcing character development and the like.



Art: 6


Now, I've never been a fan of the shoujo used in Itakiss but it is fair enough. However, being a recently aired anime, I expected a little more.



Sound: 6


Didn't think of it as anything remarkable but it worked well enough.



Characters: 8


One of the things I loved most about Itakiss is its wide variety of characters ranging from Kin to Kotoko to Irie, there is a very big spectrum of personalities that make this anime rather special and even more hilarious. As far as character development goes, it felt somewhat rushed but it worked overall.



Enjoyment: 8


I thought it was very entertaining and hilarious.

Itazura na Kiss is truly a masterpiece. I would not recommend it to someone who watches anime for action and graphic effects, although the art style is unique and fun to watch. It is simply a romance with many twists and unexpected turns that will keep you on your toes. The characters are just to die for, especially ones like Kotoko and Irie's mother! The music is nice, but some of the voices are.... interesting... and the english, well, the english is almost as funny as the jokes, so I can't really complain about it. This anime always leaves me laughing and dying to knowwhat happens next. Truly marvelous.\n\n
The story is about Kotoko, who has had a crush on Irie for a long time. Simply put, he is smart; she is not. He rejects her immediately, but when she must move into his house because her house collapses in an earthquake and their fathers are old friends, can he resist this loveable, adorable, adventurous girl forever? It is deffinately worth your time.

I've found that Itazura na Kiss is one of the best romance anime I've ever come cross, rivaling even Clannad, and likely exceeding it. Yes, I said it! I will explain. (Advanced warning, this is a long and in-depth review). 
1. Story. (10/10)  
The Good: The plot, at first glance, really isn't anything to fawn over. Quite frankly, it's probably fairly easy to pass up on premise alone. What sets this anime apart from countless others is that it goes beyond getting the guy/girl. It shows humans being human (usually in a funny, over-the-top manner). It has its ups and down, happy moments, sadmoments, and it completely immerses you into their world. This anime goes beyond confessions, a kiss, or school life. You see hardship. You see struggle. You see tears. You see joy. You see yearning. You see desire. You see...life. You rarely get that in this type of anime.


2. Sound. (9/10)


The Good: The voice acting in this amine, in my opinion, is absolutely perfect. The voice actors did a phenomenal job portraying these characters. It didn't feel like voice acting- it felt like they really WERE the characters. Needless to say when the voice actors of Irie-kun and Kotoko made cameo appearances in the latest live-action I squealed like a fangirl for days with instant replays at the ready. 


The Bad: While not exactly bad, the soundtrack wasn't memorable for me. I've watched this anime a few times, and I no matter how often I watch it, the music is just...okay. It does what it needs to do, but that's about it. I give it a high score of 9 in this regard simply because of the voice acting. 


3. Art. (9/10)


The Good: It was cute. Given the kind of anime it is (and the year), I found the art to be very effective and pleasing. It was smooth and set the moods to perfection. The facial features and body language says what words can't, and the scenes are easy on the eyes, earning it a solid 9. 


The Bad (why it's not a 10): Call me bias, but Irie-kun was simply not believable as a high-school student (at the end of the day, you have to blame the mangaka artist for this). From the very beginning he looked like a man in his mid-20s. While there were times he looked younger, overall- his design didn't appeal to me. The same can be said of a few others as well. This is, of course, my opinion. I also didn't like how the story encompasses so long a time, yet only one person aged.  Irie Yuuki (Naoki's little brother) was the only one to be marked by the passage of time, and quite drastically. His growing up from a boy to a young adult was the only real sign that significant time passes by in the anime, which might make it confusing at times since time skips aren't always in-your-face obvious. 


4. Characters. (9/10)


Kotoko: If you want a laugh, Kotoko delivers. She's over-the-top, determined, hopeless, idiotic (I say this in a nice way), and simply a delight to watch. However, she's can also be extremely irritating, even more so than Irie-kun. To her credit, she grows a lot during the series, but in the end she may leave you scratching your head asking why she still behaves in such a childish manner. I'll give credit where it's due: she's consistent, if nothing else. 


Irie Naoki (aka: Irie-kun): Let's face it, Irie-kun is a jerk. I'm assuming most of us know this. If not, now you know. I think it's safe to say no woman in her right mind would waste her time on him. Luckily for us, Kotoko doesn't think as I do. In the anime more-so than the live-action counterparts, you can't find too many endearing qualities about him. That being said, Irie-kun grows a lot. More than anyone else, I think, and it's utterly amazing to watch his transformation from heartless cad to emotional human at the end. 


The minor characters were enjoyable and get their chance to shine. Kin-chan, especially. These minor and supporting characters really bring the anime to life. Because it takes place over the course of several years, you get to see everyone's lives as they develop and change. While the main focus is on Irie-kun and Kotoko, it does an okay job of keeping you up to date on other characters. 


Irie-kun x Kotoko: Their relationship is utterly believable and a perfect example of a yin-yang couple in terms of personality and how they complete one another. By the end of the series, you can feel the love they have for each other.  They make it real. It's not forced and the pace of their romance is understandable, considering. No matter how often I watch it,  they leave me speechless in my respect for their relationship by the end of the series. It is largely for this reason that this section gets a 9 from me, despite the individual character flaws. 


5. Enjoyment : (10/10) 


The Good: The plot was consistent, didn't leave any loose ends, and leaves you with a happy feeling and a sense of loss because it's over. When it was over, I think I went into withdraw and had to immediately watch it again. To put it lightly, I was obsessed. I've ended up reading the manga and watched every live-action adaptation (including the newest one that recently finished airing). So yeah, I'd say I my enjoyment was great. 


6. Overall. (10/10) 


I, and fans of this anime, are probably just happy that the anime was completed considering the mangaka died before the manga was finished. Thanks to notes left behind, the anime effectively ended the story in the best way possible, and not just for the main characters. This manga/anime spurred three unforgettable live-action adaptations (more than that if you count seasons separately) and I couldn't ask for anything more. Sure, I can sit and wonder how much better the anime COULD HAVE been, but that's not going to change what this is. And that's a great anime for what it's meant to be. In my opinion, no other romantic anime I've seen has come anywhere close to matching it, making it about as close to a masterpiece as a romance anime can get.

How do I put this. The story was interesting to begin with, but it got very predictable and boring fast. What annoyed me most about the story was how easily I knew what was going to happen. I could say "He's going to become a doctor now," and then he did. Not once was I surprised by what happened. The art was okay. It definitely wasn't the best, but nor was it the worst.
 Now the sound. The sound was alright, except for Jinko, and some of the sound effects. I don't mean to offend the voice actor, but Jinko's voice was very annoying andI think the voice actor went overboard with it.


 Now it's time for my biggest problem with this anime. The characters. Kotoko is completely and utterly useless and helpless, not to mention she has no self respect. I get that some things are hard to do, but nobody is bad at everything. She can't even walk 2 steps without messing up. Not to mention she let herself be bullied and treated like crap just because she had a crush on some guy. Now on to Irie. I get the whole "Cold- hearted misunderstood know-it all" thing they're trying to do. But he honestly was a huge jerk to her. But then out of the blue he kisses her and she falls for him again. He repeatedly ignores her and then goes out with another girl, treats her like crap, and then asks her to marry him. What kind of relationship is like that? (if you're in a relationship like that, I suggest to get out of it as fast as possible, or find a way to communicate) Irie is actually quiet mean. The supporting characters were more interesting, and seemed to have more depth then Irie. Not to mention that the characters don't change. It goes from their senior year of high school, to when they have their own daughter, and Kotoko is still a mess and completely usless, and Irie is still mean and doesn't show her an affection. Even her daughter makes fun of Kotoko. 


That being said, I'm not going to totally trash on it. If you're looking for a light-hearted anime and don't really mind if it's perdictable, then I would recommend it. It was a little heart warming seeing them grow-up and I did feel a bit happy for them (I'm not completely heartless), but it wasn't a very good story and plot. Overall it was mediocre, wouldn't mind watching it again if I really had too, but it's the characters personalities, especially Irie's that make it a 4.

WARNING (Some spoilers ahead)
Itazura Na Kiss is a very shallow anime that reminded me some Telenovelas my mother used to watch back in the 90's . You know the ones where you thought where like fairy tales when you where young but upon closer inspection when you got older you realised that they where pretty messed up .
Like those Itazura Na Kiss is about a poor , clumsy , insecure girl with a rough past falling in love with a rich , handsome and smart jerk with a pretty shallow life . The two start living together by a twist of fate and Irie asthe stereotypical jerk that he is beggins to bully Kotoko non stop . Up until episode 14 or so anyway because Kotoko's cheerfulness eventually wins him over because it makes his life more exciting and they get married .


If you have seen any soap operas then you have seen this premise about a million times before and that's not so bad after all this anime was primarily made for young girls.


The problem is that just like some Telenovelas there is zero character progression here . Even after they get married Irie still treats his wife like dirt so naturally i expected Kotoko to eventually overcome her insecurities and leave Irie for good or make him realise his wrong doings


Unfortunately nothing changes not even after Irie hits Kotoko for standing up to him thus making this show feel .....shallow...It really made me think that the only reason Kotoko is staying with him is because of Irie's money and fame which I bet wasn't the reaction they wanted 


If the moral of the story was to show the viewer an abusive relationship based on fears and insecuritites from both parties then my review would be different but that's not the case as the show tries pretty hard to convince you that what you are seeing is normal


I know this show is beloved and I respect that but I personally found nothing of worth here 


3/10 (Poor)


Thank you for reading :)

This anime is one of the most infuriating, secondhand-embarassment-inducing, annoying shows I ever have or will watch. The main character is completely two-dimensional; her only driving  motivation in life is to be close to, and try to win over, her holier-than-thou douche-nozzle of a love interest. There is no character growth at all over the course of the series; she annoys him into settling for her, and then she rides off into the sunset towards a life of utter mediocrity. 
Story: 4. Bleh. I went into this exciting for a story that is 'not your typical highschool romance', but what I got? Ew. Putit back where it came from plz.


Art: 7. The art itself was fine. It's not exactly memorable, but there's nowhere that it was really lacking, either. It was just kinda "meh, alright, that's fine"


Character: 3. I won't even go into all the things that are wrong and lacking with the characterization. The one thing that I will say, is that Irie (male lead) has absolutely no redeeming qualities from my perspective. And the female character is obviously not only clueless, but completely lacking in self-respect to put up with his shit. It borders on abusive; the image of a dog being repeatedly mistreated and beaten by its owner, and then crawling back oblivious wagging its tail, comes to mind. 


Enjoyment: 4. I kept hoping it was going to get better, and when it became clear it wasn't, I thought I owed it to the show to keep on going to the very end. But in reality, I quit a few episodes after that. 


Overall: 5. It was just... ew. I know a lot of people like it, and if I squint I can hazard a couple loose guesses as to why, but it still really doesn't make sense to me.

Itazura Na Kiss gets a lot of mixed reviews. Some love, others hate it. I am one of the ones who love it. Itazura Na Kiss is one of the few romance amines out there that actually follows the characters lives outside of highschool. It is also unique in the way that the main couple doesn't actually get together until they are in college.
Story: As I said earlier, this story is a unique one. Sure, it starts off with the cliche klutz of a girl with a huge crush on the popular highschool genius. And it does remind me of Lovely Complex, in how themain girl is persistent in winning the heart of her true love. But think, in this industry, is anything original anymore? Anyway, the main guy, Naoki rejects the love the main girl, Kotoko. All throughout the years, she still consistently tries to win over Naoki. She faces trial after trial, but eventually, Naoki budges and realizes that he does have feelings for her. He treated her badly up until this point, but that is understandably, at least from my perspective. I believe he treats her badly because he can't come to terms with his own feelings about her, so even though he begins to fall for her, he still treats her the same way he did when he had none at all.


Art: The art style is doable. Sure, it's a bit old, but I have no complaints about it. It's very bearable, and the colors are still vibrant. The art style is consistent all throughout the show.


Characters: At least for me, the characters are the type of characters that grow on you. I didn't like any of the characters at first, with the exception of the parents surprisingly. But as time went on, as the characters grew older and started to face trials of their own, even for some of the minor characters, they began to grow on me one by one. By the time the show ended, I liked each of the characters and didn't wish them to be any different. 


The character development however, was very little. Aside from the characters falling in love with each other, their actions are pretty much the same as their younger selves. Naoki's brother went through the most character development.


Overall: By the second half, I enjoyed this show very much. I'd recommend it to anyone who enjoys he romance genre, especially to the ones who are looking for one that goes beyond the highschool first kiss. 7/10

I watched this anime when I was quite young, so it does have a close place in my heart. I watched it expecting to be bored out of my mind, because lets be honest, the plot isn't amazing or spectacular. I've seen a storyline like this a dozen times in shojo manga. But I was pleasantly surprised to find how much I enjoyed it.
It was really the characters that pulled the whole thing together for me. From kotoko's never give up attitude, to the supporting casts comedic ways, each episode always left a smile on my face. Easy going , feel good and fun to watch!
What can I say about this show that hasn't already been said? 
I suppose what I like most about the show is its time span, without giving away spoilers, the show spans over several years and so you get to see characters and their relationships develop over that time, which not that many shows do. Usually shoujo stories have a very basic goal, for the main characters to get together and don't usually explore what goes on afterwards.
Having said that, I do see why some people don't like it. True it is a very typical shoujo storyline and the main characters can be slightly irritating, frustrating and or annoying at times, but I have to say that I LOVE THIS SHOW. A lot  of peoples complaints are about the main female lead, but in many ways I find her quite relatable, being someone who is a bit clumsy and not that graceful. I am fully aware of the faults and to be honest if you wanting something rich in story detail or in depth plot then maybe you should give it a miss. But if you want something that's easy going and fun to watch then give it a go.

Itazura na Kiss. At first I had no idea what this show was, that is, until I saw the English title: Mischievous or Playful Kiss. That's when I realized, I had seen this title before. It was from a Korean Drama called Playful Kiss that I had tried watching a couple of years ago. I couldn't get past the first three episodes. I remember thinking the female protagonist was a total moron for chasing after the douchebag main male character who treated her like garbage. It annoyed me so much I had to stop watching it.
Now I found the original source's anime adaptation, and well,I was able to sit through it all at least.


Honestly, you could look at this show two ways. Either, it's a story about a kind, loyal, devoted young woman who falls for an emotionally stunted young man, and as a result of her steadfast love for him, he grows emotionally and becomes a better man who learns how to cherish her. OR. It's about a hopeless silly girl who, due to mere shallow attraction for a smart, good looking kid, winds up in a somewhat abusive relationship, cloying for whatever affection he decides to give her; oh, and she wears him down till he ends up liking her back.


My emotional side wants to see this show from the first perspective, but my sensible side leans more towards the latter. Let's just say, if this were a real couple, her friends and family would be practically begging her to leave him no matter how good looking or smart he is. Naoki Irie is NOT good boyfriend material, ladies, and even though he changes near the end, don't expect a real person to. It doesn't always turn out that way. That being said, it was sweet to see how he does seem to fall in love with Kotoko, even if that does finally happen only in the last six episodes or so.


Personally, I would say this show is all right. Most of the characters are very likable (I found myself rooting for Kotoko's guy friend and an exchange student more than I was for her and Naoki), and it's not too hard on the eyes, I suppose. I just wish the payoff to the whole series had come sooner than later. Plus, did they REALLY have to make Kotoko have a jealous fight with her KID over Naoki?? Give me a break.

SLIGHT SPOILERS. READ AT OWN RISK.
Most romance animes are quite slow paced, and is usually boy chase girl or girl chase boy. Heck, it takes the whole season just to get a confession. But Itazura na Kiss is different. What happens after the confession? Do they get married? Do they have a family? In this anime, you get to see their life about 10 years after they first meet.
The story is considered a classic. It was made in the 90's afterall, so there may be some cliques here and there. Not so bright, but super determined girl (Kotoko) chases smart, handsome, cold boy (Naoki). HonestlyI was kind of annoyed at the characters in the beginning but I quickly changed my opinion after just a few episodes. Kotoko (the main girl) can't cook, is clumsy, and one of the dumbest people in school, but she sure has determination. That's where she shines. For the 10% that Naoki can't do, she can do it like no one else can. 


Each character has their own unique personality and looks. They all stand out on their own. (The mom is really funny! and supportive. of their love. yes.) Also, you'll be seeing a lot of character development (even with the supporting characters that are only there for 2 episodes). 


The story was predictable but I enjoyed it. There's alot of comedy thrown here and there. It was pretty funny. I found myself laughing aloud at times.


The pacing was SUPERIOR. You see them grow up. So many things happen just in one episode. I thought one part was rushed and unrealistic but that may be just me.


The art style also really reminds me of the 90s. Perhaps due to respect of the author? (It reminded me alot of Sailor Moon). I was bothered by the proportions at times and Naoki's eye placement (lol) but it's all good. It fits well with what they do in the anime. It's not the best, but it works! (Heck, the side characters even look like two of the characters in Sailor Moon!) Another reason why it is so different from other romance animes! (Don't get me wrong, the animation is good and it flows.)


The sound was amazing. Ok I only recall like 3 songs they used but I can tell you the opening and ending (especially the 2nd one) is really good. It also reminded me of back then, and it was calming. Voice actors fit well.


Many people say this anime is really realistic. I didn't think so the first few episodes (I think you know what I mean if you watched it but I don't want to spoil more LOL) but I saw it after some time.. Dreams, determination, limits, family problems, marriage, jealousy, unfortunate moments. Everything is there.


I think you'll like this series alot. Whether or not you like romance. It was really enjoyable and unique. I think I can watch it like 50 times.


Honestly I was so emotionally attached to this anime. It's one of my favorite romance animes. I finished it in under 24 hours..(but that's because I had an unintentional all nighter cause I couldn't sleep so I got up earlier BUT THAT'S NOT THE POINT) I really loved the couple and how you see the cold man in the beginning open up. I liked seeing everyone in the future. I felt like I was growing up with them. It was really heartwarming but also sad. I cried. LOL


And then I cried myself to sleep knowing this fact... (You should probably read this after you watched it)


Itazura na Kiss was first published as a manga in 1990 by Kaoru Tada. Since then (as of Jan. 3 2015) there has been 4 drama adaptions and 1 anime adaption, however she would only witness one in her lifetime due to an unfortunate, unseen death. In 1999, she hit her head on a marble table while moving into a new home. She suffered from cerebral hemorrhage. She went into a coma and died 3 weeks later. The manga was never completed, but the husband told the animators how she intended to end it, so this would be the first adaptation with the "real ending".


It took 18 years since it was first published for it to become an anime. And then 6 years more to be on DvD.


Did you cry. I cry everytime. SHE WOULD NEVER SEE HER SUCCESS


Anyway..thank you so much for reading my review. This was my first one and I'm not really good with putting my feelings into words. I tried my best not to put in side comments but it's too hard. Sorry.

To be honest Itazura na Kiss is probably my favorite pure straight romance anime for a few reason that A LOT of romance anime lack entirely. You can skip to the end for a quick summary, alright getting into it...
Story: 9
Considering this is a romance anime there's really not much in terms of actual plot, so I tend to talk about the relationship between the leads and how they progress in this section and damn does this anime do it right. This anime goes extremely far in the relationship and I can legit count on 1 hand the amount of anime that actually goes thisfar, even less if its an actual romance anime. To be specific and kind of spoilerly this anime actually goes up to having kids, most tend to end at a kiss at most, and if your lucky marriage, however this goes all the way. A lot of people think a kiss is the height of a romantic relationship but that's only the beginning, the real height of any relationship is the point where you trust and love each other enough to raise a child. More notable moments like the confession is perfect as it happens at a moment of the story where substantial time has been dedicated to developing the relationship making it all the more satisfying while leaving enough time to develop the relationship even further and this show most certainly does that. I think I should also mention, as the name implies, a lot of kissing happens in this anime if your looking for that.


Art: 6

Probably the worst part of the show. Animation isn't super important, once again, because this is a romance anime, but actual presentation makes the anime look even older than it actually is. Backgrounds aren't very detailed. Generally the anime is not very good looking and is passable at best. You could say its trying to emanate a novel esque look similar to Kimi no Todoke however it kind of fails at this, as that kind of look works better in a more serious and less goofy show and this show certainly has its goofy and comedic moments, which would be fine if they changed the entire look during these more comedic moments but they keep its novel esque overlay during these moments which doesn't really work


Sound: 7

Sound didn't really stick out to me. Voice acting was descent and sfx was reasonable. The ost is not spectacular and non of the pieces stuck out, pretty average all in all. Sound is something that's just kind of glossed over in this anime. (I did personally like ED 2 tho)


Character: 8

A lot of people seem to dislike the anime or even drop it because of the characters primarily the male mc, Irie Naoki, and I have to agree, at times Naoki can be incredibly self-centered and an asshole on all levels. However his disposition towards Kotoko tends to makes sense in the context of the story, like (spoilers ahead) getting afraid that Kotoko would stop loving him as he wants her to love him as he loves her in return (spoilers end here). Also, most of Naoki's actions and attitude towards Kotoko tend to be only really innocent teasing I think a lot of people misunderstand this teasing for a shitty personality. It's also not like he sees NO change throughout the show, he does learn to value Kotoko more and comes to understand things about life that he previously wouldn't have without her. Kotoko herself is pretty enjoyable, instead of being stupidly in love with Naoki she likes to try hard hoping one day to 1 up him. Supporting cast is pretty awesome, especially Naoki's mom. They all actually feel like the role they are supposed to fill in our leads' lives. Antagonist like meaningless love rivals don't last very long and they all play important roles in moving Naoki and Kotoko's relationship forward. Ultimately helping to deliver a much bigger emotional payback in the climaxes of the story. Ikezawa Kinnouske is the only exception to this, he's literally the worst, way worse than Naoki in my opnion, everyone else is cool.


Enjoyment: 8

I really enjoyed this anime, many of the more notable moments are so well done and satisfying, which is important as those moments are what you are looking for in your romance anime. The end is incredibly fulfilling as it goes all the way with its romantic story leaving an incredibly satisfying ending that is close to unheard of in most romance anime that more anime should really do.


Overall: 8

Watch if you want to see...

-A romantic story that actually goes past marriage

-Incredibly satisfying romantic story

-Incredibly well done flags (milestones in the relationship)

-Satisfying character developments with the leads

-A ton of genuinely intimate moments between leads

I loved Itazura na Kiss more than I loved my entire existence. It was my life. The lead characters got together, they got married, they had a kid, it was awesome. I thought it was way better than the anime in which the characters take the whole season to realize their feelings and act on them, and there may or may not be a kiss at the end. I liked it, it was nice, it was good. The guy was good for eventually liking the girl, and the girl was a hero for getting the guy. 
Hahahahahah...The past is a scary, scary place. Where doI even start?


Story: A girl's house breaks down and she and her father move into the house of her father's friend, and the son of that friend just happens to be the girl's crush, who does not like her back, and he makes this fact very clear to her. The two are on two polar opposites of the academic spectrum, with the guy being the smartest one in their school, and the girl is among one of the dumbest. The girl lives her life with this boy in her mind and does anything to please him. The anime shows their life starting from the end of high school, and goes well into their adult life. What I don't like about this plot is the plot. It's a romance anime, so it should be about romance, but I just do not like the romance. Yes, the love is unrequited at first, but later on, the two leads are mutually in love, so it should seem so. The whole time, I just felt like I was watching how a girl with low self-esteem handles herself in an abusive relationship.

2/10....shame 


Art: I liked the character designs, Kotoko is cute, everybody looks different, but they failed to show what makes Mr. Genius so handsome to everybody. Beauty is in the eye of the beholder but considering how every girl in the anime is willing to kill herself for some Irie, he is not that much of a catch. Since not much was invested in developing the main guy's non-existent personality, they could have made him a bit more charismatic. 

6/10


Sound: I like the opening and both endings, I also love Kotoko's seiyuu, I am a fan of her music and I think she is a perfect fit. We could have gone without the "Irie-kun!!!!~" though.

7/10


Characters: Easily the worst part of this anime. The only reason I didn't give this a 1 out of 10 is because I like the mom. 

Kotoko is dumb. Everyone in the anime knows she's dumb, but they seem to be confused as to the reason why she is. They think it's because of her grades; that is why they think Irie, who is stupid too, is a genius, because of his class rank. What. a. load. of. bull. Kotoko has no self-esteem. I do feel bad for her, but at the same time, she is not real. The creator of this anime tried to make her love story seem like a beautiful thing, like winning the heart of a guy who everyone thinks is too good for her is an awesome thing, like pleasing him so he thinks better of her is great for her. How awful. She's no angel though. While Irie only likes her because she feeds his ego, Kotoko only likes Irie for his looks and popularity. There is literally no other reason. They don't have heart-to-heart talks about their feelings, they don't laugh togther or acknowledge mutual issues. The whole anime was just Kotoko embarrassing herself. Irie is an example of that one bad ex many girls have who is supposed to help the girl realise their worth, work on themselves, and find someone else who respects them. Irie is portrayed as a smart guy who is bored with life, and is not very ambitious, because he is so good at everything. Maybe he is insecure deep-down, but the anime never touched on that. They could have done more with his personality so we can understand the roots of his douchebaggery and make him into a more like-able character. Maybe Kotoko brings out his ambition, or maybe she makes him a better person, but the anime made it seem like she was just a source of entertainement to make his life less boring. Irie could have been a great character. He could have been nicer to Kotoko, and Kotoko could have grown a backbone but no.

2/10


Enjoyment: At first, I enjoyed this anime because I thought it was good, then I enjoyed it because of how bad it was, now I just can't enjoy it. 


4/10

IF YOU LIKED IT, DON'T THINK ABOUT IT. THINKING ABOUT IT RUINS IT.
Story (6): unusual, but built of cliche. Goes the whole spectrum from shoujo into josei and into a new genre of anime probably to be identified by future generations as "obaa-san". Kinda random over timewarps, too. Ooh, and MonF bitchslaps are hella romantic - that's how every single romance really gets serious here. And there are A LOT.
Art (9 chars/ 4 everything else): Character models great, but then somebody obviously ran out of cash. Well, either that or the Korean/Vietnamese places that generally take care of CGI, backgrounds, and juicy colours went onstrike or something. EXPECT WELL-ANIMATED CHARACTERS - some very expressive, some just really cool solutions, and some like the Osakans or the foreigners just impossibly hilarious to look upon... BUT ALL THAT ON BLAND GREY BACKGROUNDS. LIKE THE WORST, EVER. A LOT. (you get used to it)


Sound (6): ED2 or whichever was Go!Go!7188's "Kataomoi Fighter" was awesome. Other OP/EDs were bland. Some interesting use of song and sound in-episode for tension and mood, though.


Characters (6): I don't think you're SUPPOSED to like the characters. I was somewhat bothered by my impressions of the lot of them, but after the second half gave even the butt-ugly lower-class Kansai kid with a heart of gold his five minutes of asshattery, I decided to relax any and all attachments to the characters - and started enjoying the series. Everyone's here for the lulz. 


Btw, if you think the antifeminist position is bad, check out the intra-Japan "racism" (Kansai/Osakans and especially the country bumpkins are both drawn and treated as above and beyond fugly). Only a baka-gaijin character ever takes poor Kin-chan seriously, and he spends the second half of the series slooooooooowly processing the fact that no, she's for real and not just out to screw with his mind. The rest of the cast are properly horrified.


Oh well, it was still fun.



Enjoyment (9): Strange, huh? Maybe it appeals to our inner maso side. Watched all 25 eps in one sitting. Yes, even ep 25, which seemed to exist just to make fun of the village people and remind everyone that there IS in fact something worse than being from Osaka.


Overall (7): The more I thought about it, the more this dropped. I started out wanting to give it a 9 or 10, then compared it to the level of real 9 and 10s - ...nope!

So sadly, this is one of the anime that will get a low rating from me.


Okay, enough ranting of story. :3 Let's keep going!

Story 6: Reason? There isn't really a plot, no grand moment where the two are sprung together (save for the minute detail of being bunged into the same house of the love infatuation that could have been played better), any problems or potential long running back-stories are only really superficial and are soon resolved by the protagonist's bizarre dedication to the man of her dreams. Throughout the first few episodes I was thinking there could be some progression in terms of plots and I admit to enjoying how the stories of the first few sessions turned out but these soon faded with the second partof the series.


Art 8: The landscapes and scenery might be average to some but I quite liked the way in that they were drawn and animated. With most shoujo's expect over the top flower petals, shimmering bubbles of light and hazy fuzy lighting effects when a daydream or something vaguely romantic occurs. This happens a fair amount in this anime, more than any other I've seen since our main protagonist appears to have flashbacks/fantasy daydreams every other five minutes. I found it sweet but potentially unnerving in places that they consisted nothing but the love interest. 


Sound 7: Didn't really find much wrong with it. The opening sequences could have been done in a better way, sound effects were average but nothing stood out to be as needing to be changed.


Character 4: This has to be the harshest rating I've given an anime in the history of ... well history. Why you ask? Shoujo in general does not submit altogether excellent, well rounded characters in the first place but each member of other mangas I have read have left me either empathetic towards a character in a bad situation or respectful of how their life and personality unfolds. Sadly here there is no development with the main female role, whom exists soully to grow up and be devoted to the one she loves. Cute right? I would have thought so if the writers just gave her a few details else that made her unique and original next to the love interest but everything she has done, or is about to do is for someone else. Despite being fairly headstrong in some places it really surprises me she completely has no life plan at all other than to devote her living and job to her partner. This irked me greatly as this is an extremely old fashioned way of presenting females with no self will or self motivation to go 'their own way' without male influence. 


As for the love interest, it's hard to really understand exactly how Kotoko fell for Naoki in the first place; sure with most jerks we secretly reveal he's got a heart of gold or has redeeming features to the viewers. In this particular anime he gets away with constantly putting Kotoko down in public, in front of family and friends and honestly couldn't find an ounce in respect he has towards her. Most of the time my brain was begging the writers to do just something that made him likeable to the common non-infatuated woman who cares not just for material value such as good lucks or good grades.


Enjoyment 6: If putting key flaws aside is easy for you and you're just in the mood for some quiet and simple shoujo anime then this could easily score higher than a 6 for you but I found as the series progressed I was getting more and more weighed down by how little change there was in the progression of character, story and general feel for the anime.


Overall averaging @ 5.8; rating of 6. Decent but not really up the street of someone who wishes to see rounded, interesting characters, a decently explainable plot line and free thinking independent women. Sadly I fell into all three.

This anime tells about a young hopeless girl in love. Just who does she fall in love with? None other than the cold hearted genius of her high school. Itazura na kiss tells of the hardships the two face through out their school lives, while ever so slightly falling for each other. 
The whole thing was well thought out, the humor was most enjoyable, and the romantic parts made you just what to cry out in awe. This overall was one of my favorite animes of all time.

Alright, let me start off by telling you one thing. I dropped this anime twice.
Twice.
I had it on my list for months and never watched it. I finally went around to cleaning out my "plan to watch" and this went.
Then I saw a small clip from it somewhere on the web. I decided to give it a one episode chance. It was hilarious, and the characters were instantly well developed.
My favorite part of the anime was Kotoko's persistance, and Irie's consistently cold nature, I loved how sarcastic he could be and how mean he was. It was absolutely funny through out.
The intro and ending songswere okay, but I didn't particularly enjoy or dislike them. The rest of the music was alright.\n\n
All the characters were very well defined immediately. The story has many arcs that are thoroughly played out and absolutely enjoyable. I don't want to spoil anything major but I will say the anime is wonderful for a huge reason - it goes past the point most anime end and continues into the future.\n\n
It's a great, yet overlooked anime. \n\n
I recommend it to everyone looking for a good laugh, some feels here and there, and an anime that'll make you want to just want to watch the next episode.\n\n

I loved this series. It has a very unique story and not only does it have good high school life romance it also goes beyond high school romance onwards to getting jobs as adults and marriage. I also loved the main characters Kotoko and Irie because of their personalities and on how what one lacks the other has. I love seeing every episode the progression between the two and the obstacles they have to overcome. The art style isn't bad either. By far this anime has to be my favourite romance and far outranks any of the modern romances in my opinion.

This show, in the end, had a sense of fulfillment that most shojo anime lack. Instead of giving us a stressful and tedious "almost romantic" couple, Itazura Kiss shows a growing romance that progresses all the way though that annoying teenage crush phase into Marriage and beyond. But, even with this rare romantic progression, this show quickly becomes one of the most annoying descents into hell that one will ever encounter. 
The story progression is really the only saving grace for this show's disastrous main character, Kotoko Aihara. Her antics that were cute in the beginning became less so as she grows older and goesout into the world. There is no way that anyone with her behavior would be successful in any way let alone in any romantic relationship. The show tries to explain how Kotoko is desirable throughout the different arcs and conflicts but they fail to show any true value in her actions. \n
If this story had taken itself a little more seriously then this could possible have become a great show. But, as it is now, Itazura Kiss is no more than a mediocre attempt at showing the great trials and triumphs of love.
