A highly overlooked anime in the romance category. When asked about my favorite romance animes the first one that always comes to mind is Itazura Na Kiss. How could it not? This anime involves our main female character crushing on the male lead who has absolutely no interest in her. Due to housing circumstances and their fathers being family friends the two must live together for a period of time. This gives Kotoko time to slowly (very slowly) win over Irie. This anime more than any gives me the happy ending I crave.

To be honest, it's been about the sixth or seventh time that I've re-watched this series. It's almost become a tradition of sorts to just re-watch over again (I'm usually not one to go and re-watch many anime series over, because I don't feel like it). I'm also not one who enjoys shoujo that much, but this series has always stuck with me. Sure sometimes the art isn't so great, or the characters aren't quite developed, but I still love this anime, from the bottom of my heart. 
It's your typical shoujo, where Kotoko falls in love with Naoki, someone who's far out of herleague. Though through her perseverance, she gets what she wants, which no one should deny her of. 


To sum it up, it's cute and funny at times, and even brings me to tears every time I watch it. I'm still saddened by the death of the author of the manga this anime was adapted from. The reason I gave it a 10 is obvious, because I love it. However, I always wished there was a second season, because the ending just wasn't enough (plus there were plans for this series to get another season, but the author died, so that never happened).


This was a scatterbrained review, but I just tried putting into words what I get from this series whenever I re-watch it.

I have to admit, there were times that I laughed in this anime. Unfortunately, that's all the story had for me. The characters didn't progress too much - especially the hero and heroine... It seemed that those around them progressed in life, but their characters barely changed by the end. The hero was a complete jerk to the heroine all the way until the last episode. The last two episodes were really the only times I felt him changing into someone a little better. Why did the heroine stick to him?? Why did she put up with his hurtful abuse?? Even after marriage, he NEVERpaid attention to her unless something extreme was going on (like affair or birth - which are huge!)


Another thing, is that I can understand why the hero's mother wanted her son to marry the heroine so badly (she was the main comic relief that there can be some hope for the hero if this is his mother), but what I can never understand is why the heroine's father allowed there to be a marriage at all! And, duh! He could see how abusive and rude the boy was that his daughter was in love with - why didn't he do anything about it?? Marry for love, even if it hurts you! Go for it, daughter! I support your wretched husband. 


I personally was almost rooting for a divorce... Why did they even get married in the first place? The relationship went from man who hates girl, to man declaring he wants to marry girl - the very next day! Then, no time for dating to help him grow up and learn to appreciate the heroine before she becomes his... they were married in two weeks and he was a total butthead during the wedding and honey moon... on and on and on. 


I can drag on forever... It was entertaining, but severely frustrating. Good luck if you watch it!

Let me start by saying that Itazura na Kiss is one of the most complete romance anime i have ever watched. This doesn't necessarily mean its better than Clannad or Sakarasou no Pet na Kanojo for example, but its still up there in the top romance anime the way i see it.
Story 9/10: Similarly to Clannad, what makes this anime so good is the character development and the progression for that stage where the characters barely know each other to a point where they cant be without each other. This anime includes all of the steps to a good relationship with someone. Unlike most animethis isn't one of those main character chases someone who is way out of their league, they kiss at the end and that's it, its completely different. Like a lot of romance anime the main character tries very hard to get with the person of his/he dreams and it proves pointless for a while. But after a lot of hard work and even some tears, they end up achieving what they desired most. And what i truly loved about this anime was that it could have ended in 13 episode, but it went further on in the story of the lovers and showed how they lived their lives even after high school.


Art/Sound 9/10: This anime came out in 2008 but there were no noticeable problems with its quality. I don't generally like those anime where i feel like the producers were lazy (Bokura ga Ita) and the characters looked very simple and maybe even unappealing. This anime was perfect in the art area. I felt a lot of effort in the producing of this show. The sounds were perfect, i didn't feel like a lot was missing in this regard. 


Character 9/10: In the beginning i was hesitant to watch this anime because I don't like anime where i feel that the main male character is always cold or a just plain wimp, but this anime surprised me. In the beginning, I hated Irie but as the anime progressed and his feelings grew I began to fully understand why most anime have to start with the characters not liking each other. This is important to the story and it highlights how vital character development is to a love story. The supporting characters could of done a better job however.


Enjoyment 9/10: I enjoyed this anime a lot. It wasn't one of those anime where it was okay but i really wanted it to end(Bokura ga Ita). It moved at a pretty comfortable pace and I wasn't at all disappointed at how it went. Honestly I have very little to complain about this anime, it was almost perfect in every regard to a romance anime.


Overall 9/10: Again barely anything was bad about this anime. Moved at a good pace, very well made characters(for the most part)and I loved how the romance went throughout the anime. When it ended I still wanted to see more regardless of the fact that it was complete for a romance anime. And i mean COMPLETE. I don't know many anime besides Clannad that were this complete. It did good in every aspect and if the supporting characters had a little more of a presence I would definitely give this anime a 10/10.

Plot: 7/10 
Summary: This anime begins with our main character Kotoko Aihara who is a third year high school student. She's in class F which is known as the "stupid class" in the school. She has fallen in love with fellow senior Naoki Irie who is the smartest, most popular and most sought after guy in school. He is in the elite class A. In an embarrassing turn of events Kotoko gives Naoki a letter confessing her long term feelings for him which he immediately rejects. When she returns to her newly built home later that night, an earthquake strikes causing her entire home tofall apart. This leaves Kotoko and her father with nowhere to go. Last minute, out of the kindness of their heart, Mr. Aihara's old high school friend offers to let the two of them stay in their house until the Aihara home can be repaired. Who is Mr. Aihara's high school friend? None other than Naoki's father. Now Kotoko has to live with the embarrassment of her recent confession while living under the same roof as Naoki. 


I give the plot on this one a 7/10 because it is just so typical! There are so many shoujo animes that are about the dumb, ditzy girl falling for the smart, popular, perfect guy that everyone likes. The one thing that redeems it is that it takes a turn that's different than most animes of its kind. Itazura Na Kiss takes Kotoko's story through not only high school, but college and adulthood. It spans over a solid 15 year time period which is really nice to see. The high school portion of this anime actually only lasts through the first seven episodes. So that difference in pace is why I like this anime over others.


Characters 6/10

The characters in this anime really annoy me to be honest. Kotoko's ditzyness really wares on your nerves after awhile. Actually it doesn't even take that long to tire of her. Yet, as the story progresses they do an excellent job of progressing her character. She never completely changes but gets a lot better. Naoki has his own set of problems. He's just rude. There's really no other way to describe it other than that. You watch the entire show hoping he's going to get better, and he does, but not too much. The other side characters also get annoying and random at times. Some of them become unnecessary toward the end. They pop up randomly and you almost forget they existed. That being said, the overall story progresses the characters well. In the end, you get to see what happens to each one of the ones who are actually important parts of the story. It leaves no loose ends which is something a lot of other animes do.


Music: I really can't give music a proper score on here because it doesn't really exist in this anime. I mean, yes they have background music in it but it's nothing I can really pinpoint as being bad or good. It's just... there.


Animation: 6/10

The animation in this isn't bad by any definition of the word. It's decent enough. There's just nothing about it that makes it more than average. It's just basic, fairly fluid and has decent use of colors. At times I did find it almost to have a blurry unfocused quality about it. So I found it just, meh.


Overall: 8/10

You may be wondering, why did you give this anime such a high overall score when you didn't give any of the sub categories a super high score? If I was making this review after I watched it the first time I would have given it a 5 or 6/10. But I actually rewatched it and enjoyed it a lot more the second time. I feel like with this anime, the more you put into it, the more you get out of it. To properly enjoy it you have to really read between the lines and think about why the characters are the way they are. I noticed a lot more about Naoki especially the second time around. There is a decent amount of comedy to balance out the drama as well. So to me the negative aspects that I mentioned above are mostly outweighed by the things I enjoyed. If you watch it once and like it, definitely try watching it again after a couple of months or so and you might like it even more.

First of all, shoujo and romance are my favourite genres. Usually it's about a girl who falls in love with her prince and we get to know their story - how they get along/how their relationship works. When I started to watch Itazura na Kiss, I wouldn't imagine that it will be so entertaining and amazing!
The story is told from Kotoko's view. We can hear her thoughts and opinions. We get to know her life, her goals and dreams, her feelings. The story is well-told, it has a decent ending, but for me it would be more fun if I could hear Naoki's thoughts sometimes.
Itis simple but great. I was never bored or waited for an episode's end. And how entertaining is it? There are some live action adaptations too, and they are all popular.\n\n
Both main and supporting characters are loveable. They are well-rounded and change as the story goes on.\n\n
Once you start to watch it, you just can't get enough of it. I re-watched it a few times and it's still fun and adorable. The graphics and music fit this anime perfectly.

A pretty standard shoujo series, but has wonderful character development.
PLOT: Typical shoujo girl falls in love with boy, but he’s an aloof prick type show – but what makes Itazura different is that it follows this couple for 10 years! We get to see Kotoko & Naoki’s life from high school to parenthood and it’s a very enjoyable ride. The middle section dealing with University is a bit slow and seems to be trying too hard to be interesting, but the high school and post uni arc’s are good. Itazura has some brilliant characters and an excellent supporting cast – I think my favourite hasto be Naoki’s fangirl mother, some of the best comedy is provided by her. Kotoko is an idiot who doesn’t know when to quit, but a likeable idiot nonetheless. I had difficulty liking Naoki though, he can be an utter bastard at times and his little brother is irritating as well. Overall the strong point of Itazura is its character development. By following the same people over 10 years it gives plenty of time to let the characters mature and its this point that made this shoujo romcom stand above the competition for me.


ANIMATION: Oh dear – the animation is in a word, ugly. Terrible character designs – Kotoko never ages, Naoki is meant to be gorgeous but isn’t bishie at all and everyone is shapeless. The budget on this show is obviously minimal as backgrounds are plain and everything lacks detail. Colours used are also dull and washed out looking, animation quality is not the best here.


MUSIC & VOICE ACTING: Did not like the OP much, and the EDs were OK for the genre. Didn’t notice the BGM much so it was neither good nor bad. Voice acting is great though. Since the characters are what made this show worthwhile for me all the seiyuu did wonderful jobs bringing their characters to life.


All in all a shoujo romcom that while it suffers from bad animation and a flabby middle section, is a very good watch with great fun characters and lots of development.

Itazura na Kiss. What can i say about this anime. 
JUST WATCH IT. i simply cannot recommend this enough. it honestly doesn't matter if you're a fan of the shoujo genre or not, this is a wonderful, wonderful, uplifiting, hilarious, heartwarming series for all.
my main qualm with the typical shoujo romance storyline is the incredibly unrealistic amount of opposition/ interferences the two main protagonists usually have to battle against (again in a completely unrealistic way) in order to be together. in my opinion this just ruins the story, even if i find it truly engaging at the beginning. this is also what somehow ruined HanaYori Dango for me. but in all honestly itazura na kiss does NOT fall into this incredibly annoying formula. sure, there are the occasional obstacles to overcome but they're all resolved in a believable way and they're not dragged out for so long you start pulling your hair out in infuriation. 


yes, the initial plot falls into the typical shoujo formula, but it's what the mangaka DOES with the forumla that is so refreshing and engaging. you really do feel so invested in the characters and you form a real emotional attachment and engagement with them that is hard to find in anime usually. sure, there is some one-dimensional quality to some of them at first but even the supporting characters develop and grow as the anime progresses. 


what underpins the anime as a whole, and the reason why it is so endearingly wonderful is the relationship between the main characters. they really do grow and develop as people throughout the series and the trials and tribulations they encounter are mostly very relateable and real. of course, the absolute hilarious situations and unique characters all add to the enjoyment of the series, but it's the relationship of the main characters that really carry it through and (for me anyway) elevates it above the poloi of shoujo animes.


so, what i'm really trying to say is that just because the series initially falls into the typical shoujo setup shouldn't deter you from at least trying it out, because what's done WITH that shoujo formula is what makes it a truly remarkable, touching series that will stay with me for a long time to come.

Alright, let me start out by saying that I avoided this series for a LONG time. Why? Because the main guy, Irie, is a complete jerk. And he stays a jerk for the first 13 or so episodes (although you see moments where he's softening from time to time.) I also have a problem with less-than-intelligent female leads (as shoujo seems to be chock-full of stupid heroines). 
So why did I rate this series so highly? Because it was absolutely DARLING. The characters draw you in (despite the jerk) and they evolve, and mature, and you see their relationship progress even after they have thatfirst kiss. By the time I reached the end of the series, I loved both of them and Irie wasn't a jerk anymore. In fact, he turned into a pretty good man. And Kotoko, the girl, became much more capable and cool as well. \n\n
So should you watch this series? Absolutely. Just stick with it through the first 13 episodes until Irie buys a clue, okay?

Itazura Na Kiss. Playful Story that challenges the shoujo standard?
        Itazura Na Kiss is a comedy, romance, shoujo, that is PG-13.
     The story starts off like a typical shoujo. The female lead Kotoko is a baka, caring girl who is in love with the smart, handsome, male lead Irie. Then in a scenario that can only be made possible in a shoujo her house is destroyed by an earthquake and her and her father stay with her father'sfriend, which happens to be Irie's father. If you seen shoujo you know how it will end, the two will end up together despite the obstacles that stand before them. Yet unlike any shoujo I have ever seen it doesn't end with the two happy ending, the story continues and you watch them grow afterwards. It was a shock because the story throw in the element of slice of life in the beginning, yet unlike shoujo that just becomes outrageously unrealistic it kept that element. Before you know it you are watching episodes back to back in anticipation of what will happen in their lives because it's not just about their love, but about their life.



       The art will throw you off. It's not bad, but the characters are different. With most male leads in shoujo they look drop dead gorgeous, but this male lead looks average giving you this realist flare. Most guys that are handsome aren't really handsome, but they have that charm around them. Also the female lead is average as well. The settings are plain and simple which fits the mood of this anime.



      I didn't pay attention to the theme music, I mean for crying out loud I watched this in a day and I have a headache, but I am happy for it. However the voice actors did a splendid job. Sorry to my dub fans, but this anime is purely sub. Still do not let the fact that this anime is only in subs stop you from missing out on it. 



   The characters were cliche and typical. This is a shoujo we are talking about so it is not strange. However they still manage to grow on you and I bet some would wonder why. Well just because something is cliche doesn't mean it will not have an impact. There is almost always something unique in characters even the cliched ones and in this anime it is not hard to find. Kotoko comes off as a stupid, naive chick, but her determination makes you cheer her on because we all have our stupid moments, yet we drive further.



     I definitively enjoyed this anime and I would recommend it to a person who is tired of the same shoujo stuff and want something different even if it's just a little. I do not know though about recommending you watch the live dramas because I have not watched them and I am still considering whether I should or shouldn't.  There are three, Korean version, Japanese verison, and Taiwanese version. If you enjoy the anime and would like to check them out then go ahead.

Story (7/10):
The story of Itazura na Kiss had a standard shoujo anime premise where you have your lovable klutz MC trying to make her feelings reach the person she loves and who is the exact opposite of her in every way
The show offered some good comedy, it had many funny moments whither it was the ridiculous situations or the usual funky side characters that usually fill these kind of shows however the comedy sometimes overwhelmed some of the other aspects of the show.
The romance on the other hand was not that impressive imo it's clearly was the intention of the anime to show how astrong love will prevail at the end but somehow in this case the way the characters were portrayed mad it feel wrong on so many level (will explain further in the character part)

What might have been the redeeming factor for this anime is that it progressed beyond the school phase and into college and then the adult life however by any progress in reality it seemed like the only thing that changed was the scenery

the only part that actually seemed decent and finally showed some progress were the final 5 episodes.


Characters (5/10):

It was really annoying to watch an anime progress so far in time and not have the character follow in their growth. acting the same exact way after finishing highschool and college and even after getting married

Watching Kotoko as the lovable klutz as she struggled to get her feeling across was pretty amusing at first but after a while it just was a pain to watch . I know that they were trying to show how strong her feeling were and how true love will never fade but that was ridiculous

Naoki was simply an asshole. he toyed with the poor (although dumb) girl feelings at the beginning and seemed to only stem to action when another man was about to take her away (on two occasions) and only became a decent husband and started to treat here properly after many years of marriage (last 5 episodes. how many years passed to reach that point?) again i say I know they were trying to show how he is an awkward man and how he doesn't know nor understand how to deal with these kind of feelings but again i say that was ridiculous

How these two ended up as a happily married couple with a kid at the end is beyond me.

Side characters ranged from amusing to utterly annoying


Art and Animation (7/10):

The show looked old as fuck to be honest i am looking at the list of shows that were released spring 2008 and i am wondering why it looked so old when so many good lookin shows were released at the same time

but i guess visuals are not really the important part for these kind of shows so a 7/10 is fair


Music & VA (7/10):

The OST didn't stand out much OP and ED were normal and the voice acting was not half bad


Effectiveness (6/10):

This anime was extremely flawed. It tried to deliver a good message (Love triumph over all) but the messenger who was carrying the message fell into a river which made the message muddy and then was attacked by rabid dogs and survived only to finally get mauled by a lion:D my point is that they didn't deliver the message properly

Those 5 final episodes were a good attempt for damage control but still too late after all that damage


Overall (6.5/10)

WARNING- Lite spoiler are included, nothing big or important but be warned!
"Kotoko is incapable of doing 90% of the things i can do.
But as for the 10% i can't do, she succeeds where no one else could."
Itazura no Kiss (Playful Kiss or Mischievous Kiss) is a masterpiece of japanese manga literature written way back in 1991 by late Kaoru Tada. The manga never got finished because of the authors death. Nevertheless it became something of a must read for all romantic enthusiasts.  
Knowing all of that i just didn't want to watch something that would ruin experience that i got from reading the manga,but as i just found myself giving up on one anime after the other i had to reach for the BLACK BOOK. And first in there was Itazura no Kiss.



Anime starts of with the main character Kotoko giving a love letter to Ilie-kun, and his blunt, brutal and overwhelming rejection. But as anime faith would have it thru some strange work of forces of nature they end up living together at Irie's place, and Kotoko's everyday battle to win Naoki Irie over begins.


Firstly the story- Itazura no Kiss has a story that will never leave you stranded and thinking "Ooo god how much more of this will i have to watch?!". The story constantly, steadily and slowly progresses, thru the 25 episodes characters grow and develop, change, mature and never leave room for a dull moment. This is gonna be a bit of a spoiler, but for some ten years that we follow Kotoko and Irie you see them both mature and help each other develop into a better person. It's one of the best romance animes i ever watched, maybe the BEST!


Sparkly and shiney art- Art isn't anything new or revolutionary, it fits the mood perfectly, the nice and colorful background for the happy moments and the darker and closed scenes for the sadder. The only thing that i didn't really like in this anime is Kotoko's sometimes HUGE eyes, but that was the fab back in 2008 so i didn't mind it to much.



Sound- First i just wanna say that this anime has a AWESOME OST! The opening Kimi, Meguru, Boku and the endings Kataomoi Fighter(watch the video on YT) and Jikan yo Tomare fell like tailor made for this show, they help enhance the beginning and the end of the episodes and just sound overall great! 

The voice actors just add another dimension to the show Nana Mizuki(WWWorking, Darker then Black...) dose a superb joob of relaying Kotoko's emotions to the viewer, and Daisuke Hirakawa (Free, Fukka and Belzebub) adds a calm, secure but also a loving fell to Irie. 


Characters- Well if i had to say what makes this show great it would be easy, Kotoko and Irie! The characters are perfectly done for a 25 episode show, you see them develop, struggle, change, learn... you see them go thru life and whit that they make you fell happy, sad, even mange to bring a tear to the eye. Irie dose seem a bit cold and harsh at first but later you see his true feelings for Kotoko. 

The support characters are also well done, from the crazy mom who will make you laugh, Kinuske who is a all in all a great guy, Yuuki the young brother that helps at the moment when nobody would expect it and Miki a failure as a trap but a great friend. 

Everybody here develops and changes a bit throughout the show, and it just leaves a great impression of them all growing up and maturing together.


Was it good, the Enjoyment- If i wanted to compare the feeling that i had after finishing Itazura no Kiss with another show... well that would be hard. 

Itazura no Kiss for me raises the bar for romance anime pretty darn high. I generally loved the whole show and everything about it, it fits and it works together to make something amazing that dose not just ride on the name of the manga that it was made upon, but adds a new breath of air to ir.


In the end, overall- All in all i knew by what i read before that Itazura no Kiss isn't just another "brick in the wall" of romance animes, but after watching it, it feels like it''s the damn roof! The one or two things that i didn't like really can't even compare to all the things that i love about this show, it maybe a slow pace but at that pace it still manages to deliver. At one scene i just thought that if something bad was to happen i'm gonna cry(a 25 year old, yeah). It might not be a true emotional rollercoaster that we been feed for years, but it dose keep your eyes on the screen and wondering what's gonna happen next from the beginning to the end.


It's not like any other show, and it's great. That's how i would recommend it. It leaves the viewer feeling of complete and happy story and in my mind i think that even the late Kaoru Tada would appreciate this adaptation.  


P.S. This anime started airing on my BD, so YAY!

I've gone back and watched this three times already! it's my go-to romance anime. I love the character development and the cold shoulder/attitude that the main male character has. I highly recommend this! 
Main female character grows on you and makes you want to cheer her on! I love how she finds who she is even if it's all because of a guy. 
Honestly, the art is a little lacking but it's not bad. The characters and the story plot more than makeup for it. 
If you like the main male character to be indifferent this is your anime. If you like a determined girlseeking love this is your anime. And if you're just looking for a decent anime this more than meets those standards!

It's a will they or won't they, just that one is a utter cold genius, the other is a lovable ditz.
Itazura na Kiss follows Kotoko Aihara a ditzy girl who proclaimed her love to Naoki Irie, a genius student in his school through a love letter, through unforeseen circumstances that includes Kotoko's house being razed and Kotoko's father acquaintance, Kotoko has to live in the same roof as Naoki. Will Kotoko and Naoki, two diametric opposite personalities ever come into terms with one another even with those circumstances?...this is Itazura na Kiss. 
One of the biggest strengths LA actually had for Itazura na Kiss alsobrings up is the "hierarchy" of "just being smart" isn't all you need, if you don't have some god damn compassion to go along with your smarts, perfectly manifested in both Kotoko and Naoki, they are both diametric opposites to this, but together they not only help each other, but they help everyone else in the process and sure they "don't demolish the hierarchy", but more or less brings up the issue with the manifestation of the main protagonists and that is usually by their highschool arc, however later on it goes into evolve the message as "divert from the hierarchy of intelligence is everything" to "determination" mostly in the form of Kotoko. Next is that Itazura na Kiss just isn't a "highschool romance anime", as it does push settings from highschool to college to even career life with how this kind of relationship "develops" even further than the "will they won't they" status of the main duo of Naoki and Kotoko and that in itself is actually refreshing. Finally, Itazura na Kiss has ALOT of characters, and for the most part the majority of the characters are decent except for the characters like Yuuko Matsumoto voiced by Yuki Masuda that are just obstacles or "generic romantic rival love interests" trying to get in the way of Kotoko and Naoki relationship, however there are even what LA can call "minor character focused episodes" that do focus on the ones LA just mentioned before and some newer characters gets this, one surprisingly character being the Motoki Kikyou voiced by Mitsuki Saiga a guy who prefers to be a girl and he gets a very dedicated half-episode about his gender and how society viewed it through traditional eyes and for a 2008 anime, it's a uniquely "current" issue even now. But even with these kind of characters and the beta couples that form, they too become likable by the end of it and they too evolve or go through their own obstacles as much as Kotoko does...well to the point that LA was rooting is that if the beta couples and the minor characters have more of a focused and better development than our alpha couple...well that going into more detail in the next paragraph.


LA will say this bluntly as possible, but the biggest and most annoying flaw to Itazura na Kiss is Naoki Irie himself, why?...well it's his personality and his utter resistance to change. Irie's main deal is that he for the majority of the screentime he has, has a cold demeanor to almost everyone cept probably his family but his personality STAYS LIKE THIS THE MAJORITY OF THE TIME, sure he opens up "at times" especially in the more genuine dramatic times, but would ANYONE like a person who almost NEVER opens up only when it doesn't go his way?...even when Kotoko and Naoki's relationship progresses from highschool to college to career a la dating to married...he shows no emotion to help UNLESS he has actual competition in the romantic sense or a dramatic plot twist occurs plotwise. This is kinda what happens if your main love interest is and have always will be a deadpan emotionless being, only in URGENT moments for cheap melodrama he reacts, thus it becomes a completely one-sided romance in which the anime itself ACKNOWLEDGES. We ARE suppose to root for Kotoko and Naoki right???. Sure a similar anime LA can think of is Ookami Shoujo to Kuro Ouji has the same love duo with similar personalities especially concerning the main male love interest, but even THAT anime has almost the same problem as Itazura na Kiss has...ONLY WORSE. LA knows that after Episode 19, Naoki FINALLY starts slowly opening up to Kotoko bit by bit, episode by episode but for that development LA will say that "your 11 episodes too late (Ep.9-20), it took you long enough!!!". The only other flaw LA sees in Itazura na Kiss are all the "love interests" concerning Naoki throughout the anime, many of which DO bring up good points that he should be with people like himself, however the majority of them goes into the "rival love interest for Kotoko just because" and inevitably, we know they can't rival Kotoko (through basic romance tropes)...though some do cross the line to the point of trying to break up the two main love duo out of spite or jealousy. As for Kotoko's love interests, well they actually have a semblance concerning the plot and the romance involving Kotoko and Naoki who though one is slightly melodramatic (*cough* Kinnosuke's), question their diametric opposite relationship as whole compared to Naoki's generic love interests sans Christine. Nonetheless it's just another obstacle Kotoko has to go through to be with Naoki and annoyingly so.


LA's favourite characters goes quite easily to Kotoko Aihara voiced by Nana Mizuki as you can actually relate to her and feel her plight from an academically and romantics standpoint, the only other character that came close to her was Naoki Irie's mother Noriko voiced by Naoko Matsui, sure she's a doting parent and utterly ships Naoki with Kotoko, but she's one of brightest spots of hope to the series, as she is the only one actual good advice ad helps Kotoko is some tough spots concerning Naoki, finally on the minor characters, Christine Robbins voiced by Yuuko Gotou was a final great hope spot for likable characters and her romantic goals were admirable even if it's similar to Kinnosuke and Kotoko's earlier plot point but gender reversed. On the other spectrum, LA's most hated character in the series is if you can easily guess it Naoki Irie...he had the most problems with the anime as a whole and just his presences of "not helping his relationship with Kotoko" made the romantic aspects of the anime even more annoying...yeah not only is the main crux of the anime's problems Irie but diametrically the opposite in likability as well. LA knows LA is defending Kotoko soo much but that's only because Kotoko goes through soo much from jealous rival love interests, crazy married women to Kotoko's own personal goals and problems of her own to try and match Irie's pedestal and she almost gets NOTHING in return for all she's done. Oddly enough it's nice to see that Itazura na Kiss' HUGE cast doesn't exactly revolve around Kotoko and Naoki (cept family and current friends because being obvious) as many of the characters have cameos way later on after Kotoko and Naoki progresses through life and the minor characters (yes even those stereotypical love interests LA mentioned in the above paragraph) have their own lives, developments and goals of their own, LA can easily put this up as a HUGE strength to Itazura na Kiss that LA missed.


In terms of voice acting, the voice acting has some decent voice acting for the most part, Nana Mizuki as Kotoko has the typical heroine who's in love trope, but she does veer ALOT into the screaming shrill jealousy vocals that gets VERY annoying, though be it it's playing against the type for Nana Mizuki, but even with her broad vocals, the majority for her is the ditzy but nearly shrill scream queen vocals. There is Engrish in this anime and ohh boy does some of the background vocals have the Engrish being strong in this one, if you want to hear some typically awkward Engrish, Itazura na Kiss has it in the spades (Though Yuuko Gotou as Christine was "ok" enough for "Engrish" standards). For the most part the majority of seiyuu's do an "ok" job overall, but LA's favourite voice actor would go to Naoko Matsui as the doting mother of Naoki Irie, her shipping and eccrenticites all the way through was consistent and enjoyable. In the shrill side of things, some of the female VERY minor characters have these shrill vocals but the cream of the crop of shrillness goes to Jinko Komori voiced by Kinoko Yamada had one of the shrillest voices rivaling Chitose Morinaga voicing Flora Flemm from Asterisk War 2 most recently, LA doesn't have anything against Jinko as a character, she to like Satomi Ishikawa voiced by Risa Hayamizu is a supporting character to Kotoko, but seriously...Kinoko's vocals was annoyingly shrill.


In terms of animation, the animation by TMS Entertainment, for the most part the animation has many of the trademarks of the typical shoujoness from the emoticons to the bishie sparkles. Character designs are pretty colorful though some characters gets the "looks like her daughter/mother vibe" at times, though due to the animation they get during the "comedic scenes" and the "Kotoko jabbing moments" goes pseudo-chibi and add that to the exaggeration is typical in Itazura na Kiss and quite often especially from Noriko Irie and Kotoko. Overall the animation is decent and if LA could say the animation in two words it's "typical shoujoness", it's not a bad thing though but LA won't really rave the animation as it's not utterly perfect it's just "decent" but that's about it.


Halfway through the anime, once Kotoko is in medical school, well it gets melodramatic. But that's not why LA is pointing this out nor is it the "bad melodrama you think it is", once a new love interest for Kotoko..yes Kotoko, arrives by the form of Keita Kamogari voiced by Nobutoshi Canna, he brings up a VERY good point of "why did you marry him?" and LA utterly agreed with him, why?...as Naoki is STILL COLD towards her and hardly any help to her and hardly even communicates with Kotoko with HER problems instead whines about his and carries on with his goals only...once again...why do we have to root for these two? and sure by the halfway point many of the minor characters have evolved outside some of the stereotypical roles like Christine Robbins as a love interest for Naoki, Kinnosuke Ikezawa voiced by Shuuhei Sakaguchi a love interest for Kotoko (and a character in which LA supported his romantic goals "for the most part") and Yuuki Irie voiced by Romi Park (the snarky little brother of Naoki) and that in itself helped as LA had an obvious annoyance with the snarky annoying Yuuki Irie, but even HE got better over time and development and even the change of settings from highschool to college was a great transitional change, but if the all these can change yet if one of your main characters hardly or takes FAR TOO LONG TO...well again...it becomes a black stain to an otherwise interesting romance anime.


You could defend Naoki that his cold personality is a hard thing to change as well as his career goals gets in the way of his romantic life, but LA will remind you that Naoki DID really like Kotoko quite early on, he just couldn't express it and fine LA will say that that is a quite honest statement...what LA couldn't understand is even if he couldn't express his true feelings correctly (or at all) even after marriage is him try to resist his personality and personal goals over his romance (only at the last moment for cheap melodrama) because he DOES realize that he is married to someone...he "is" a genius right? and fine once again you can even defend that as him being socially unaware and more focused on his career than his romance. Defend Naoki or not, either way LA wanted to pull the clip of Stephen Hawking shouting "PUT SOME F-*-ING EMOTION INTO IT" at Naoki for this and easily the source of the romance being quite annoying for the first half well for LA anyways.


Thankfully the ending and LA might as well say it the last 6 episodes and Naoki's romantic flaws had improved with every episode and both the romance and drama (medical drama anyways) blended quite well together when before it was clashing quite alot. The last 6 episodes really did make payoff to all the romantic annoyances from Naoki, though the only new flaw LA saw from these last 6 episodes were that the transitions from career life to "the next step for our two main duo" were slightly rushed, nonetheless LA was pretty surprised the drama and romance blended especially well even for Kotoko and Naoki AT LAST as well as the minor character sub-plotlines were focused on along with the ending. Oddly the last episode is an aftermath of Episode 24 but the whole meat of Episode 25 is a flashback event and it also felt like it caused Naoki's emotions to be put into question as it was placed after their marriage (as he's similar to Episode 24 but having his constant teasing at the same time when he was suppose to be utterly emotionless towards Kotoko, but you can rule this out "maybe" because he's near family relatives thus he opened up but still.), thus LA would just question why couldn't Episode 24 be the final episode, it had a great dramatic and fulfilling conclusion...just seemed that TMS Entertainment needed to fill the quota or something. Nonetheless even with all the flaws and strengths of Itazura na Kiss' final 6 episodes, the "ending" (Ep. 24) was a great way to finish what was an annoyingly cold-hearted one-sided romance it was at the beginning to turn it into a nearly solid romantic drama anime.


It is quite obvious LA's main issue with Itazura na Kiss, Naoki Irie overall brought the entire anime down, he never changes his personality or attitude and he only changes temporarily for cheap melodrama and cling to Kotoko "just because" and if the anime series changes and evolves without him then it becomes a HUGE detriment to the anime and even worse in a romantic stance. Itazura na Kiss has it's strengths of the refreshing kind what with it being not merely a highschool romance anime, but it progressing into college and even to their career lives and with the time passing, even it's minor characters changing for the better, but if even Naoki Irie doesn't care about his OWN romantic relationship and evolves without him, why should we care?...Kotoko definitely deserved better than this MUCH more quickly. Itazura na Kiss as a romance is to be seen more as a sidenote melodrama and not until the final 6 episodes it truly becomes a romance, as a drama, it's strengths comes from our main duo's satellite characters more they get sidelined (even though they're the FOCUS) for the most for better development and content as well as again, it's final 6 episodes. Itazura na Kiss skirts the line between an annoying romance and a progressively changing dramatic anime. LA might of gotten Stockholm Syndrome as much as LA hated Naoki quite early on and for the first half of the anime but Itazura na Kiss as a whole is a decent romantic anime, it has it's character flaws and blinded romance elements, but it is it's Itazura na Kiss' other "features" from it's progressively evolving settings in life as well as it's likable minor characters as well it's final 6 episodes that holds up which is why LA will call Itazura na Kiss a "decent romance"...but it could have been a bit better with our unsympathetic lead putting some god damn effort into the romance department making the romance element a bit better and less annoying...but C'est la vie...or is it C'est Anime?.

Itazura na Kiss is about a Girl named Aihara, Kotoko who wants to be with the Smartest guy in the whole school, Irie, Naoki. This is where it all begins.
Story:
For me the story was quite superb. It was filled with great comedy and it really did express how Kotoko was "different" from Naoki. Its a great "love conquers all story" (with so much Comedy!)
 Art:
The art for me had a little glitch though I didn't really like how the hair of Kotoko's friend came out. It was sort of a "Misshapen Curly Hair", But overall it was Very Good. 
Sound:
The sound was great I hadno trouble with the fuss and all.\n\n
Character:\n
The Character Development was astounding, though it focused much on the two but the later episodes did help with all the "two people focused on story"\n\n
Enjoyment & Overall:\n
I was Deeply grateful I stumbled upon this anime, but alas it already ended before I knew it. Its a MUST SEE for all the people who enjoy Romance Comedy.\n

I loved this anime. Each episode made me feel something. It was very cute and very sweet.
Each episode would make my feelings go from happy to sad. Ire-kun would say something nasty or something bad would happen and then next minute Ire-kun would be really kind or something really good would happen.
I've seen a lot of mangas and animes with the same story line and similar styled characters (v.clever but cold guy, stupid girl who has a big heart). However despite those similarities. this manga really stood out. Despite the story not going into depth of many characters you still connected to them. For mei really connected with Kotoko. She was sweet and cute and she had such a loving nature that i  find in some of my very best friends. i also felt like she was a great role model. She showed love for others, considerstion, intelligence isn't everything and i thin  st of all love and determination. Actually many characters showed that. But Kotoko stood out. She made me want to work harder for what i want and also to grow up happy. Every time she was sad and cried, i felt like crying. And for me, i don't find that very often. When she held her child in her arms she made me cry because it made me want a family and someone who loves me despite my flaws (not just yet but in the future). I dunno, i just felt so touched by how happy she made me feel. Silly really but it was an interesting experience.\n
Despite some silly monents in this anime, like the actors speaking English (which sounded ridiculous. totally fake) this anime shines out because it's got a special story where the characters develop over time and make you cry when their sad.\n
The reason i give this a 9-10 score is because i couldn't stop watching

Itazura Na Kiss is a story of Kotoko and Irie Kun, whom Kotoko is in love with and Irie Kun fully aware yet is bothered by that fact and wants nothing to deal with her.
Unexpectedly, the end up living in the same house due to an accident with Kotoko and her fathers house, so Irie Kun's father welcomes both of them to stay at their place for as long as it takes. 
This story is full of great laughs and a few tear jerkers at some points, but over all the chemistry between them is absolutley admirable. I loved this anime very much, my favoriteone yet. I hope for all the people who havent seen it give it a try, because its definitley worth anyones time.

i loved this anime....i acually think it was perfect!
i always used to get anoyed with animes because of their endings. in a story like this one, usually  ends when the guy confesses and i always wonderd how the story would go on and hoped for ovas. this is one few stories which had the perfect ending that would satisfy me ~ completly!XD

I very rarely write reviews but I feel that this anime truly needs to be reviewed just to show how amazing it actually is!!
Let's just say, the story is outstanding. Nothing is done too quickly like in most romance animes. And it shows you the after-effect of their marriage which I thought was brilliant! Many animes have the girl hating the guy or vice versa (In this case it's the guy hating the girl) and after a while he falls in love with her and they expect you to think everything is fine and dandy. This anime shows you how  they also have todeal with problems while they are married which made the anime so realistic and great! 


And the characters are great since no one changes automatically ( namely Irie). The characters remains basically the same for a long while and they other characters (Kotoko) must persevere (which she does very well I might add.) and stick to their goal!


All in all, this was an amazing anime. I definitely recommend it!

This may be a bit an odd anime and it may have lack of feelings despite for sad moments comes in clichés moments but i guess this is very entertaining,interesting to watched.this series will never let you felt sad for many episodes i guess every of them will make you laugh for a while even sometimes for serious moments.The story is very quite ok it gives you interest along a few laughs,it may not be a masterpiece thou but its very fun to watch if you enjoyed romance animes.

Ha! Funny as heck is what this romance packed a punch in! where should I start...ah yes my good parts and bad parts!
I liked this anime because of it's lively romantic comedy an it's mix of lovey dovey moments. That's what makes this anime so enjoyable. Kotoko Aihara was cute, her friends too. Just the way her personality is made up is most of what Itazura Na Kiss runs it's comedy on! Heck, I think they did a not-so bad job on the laughs, and I had my laughs. Heck, I even had some tearjerkers, and they were nice too. Umm, Irie was absolutely hilarioussometimes. His kid brother too. The lovey dovey scenes were nice, the very few of them that happened, I was intrigued and it felt satisfying for those moments of Irie and Kotoko. They did start getting a tad weaker going through the mid to end parts of the series but they were few of them due to how the plot and the development was based on, which became a hindrance but hey, the moments were neat and nice to have jsut enough to make you smile! Kinnosuke and the gang, well they were funny. I did like Kinnosuke alot though, because he was actually involved in Kotoko's life! The rest of Irie's friends and peers other than Irie's family and all, well... nothing much to say to that. Oh btw there's marriage!



What I dislike about the anime well haha you guessed it is the story. This is one of those animes that like when you go time traveling in a fast car months and years into the future, and then you finally arrive to the future at ferrari-esque speeds, and then the plot couldn't keep up with the car...turns out the development for the characters that had something going for them just sat out away from the car too...Hence the result, the characters development were fail. This is IMO remember that. I thought I never got to see enough Irie! I thought I understood Kotoko, but nooo...Umm when an issue happens, it's so hasted, and so like..idk...but it's synthetic. It ain't fresh, it isn't lively, it's like the same old boring-looking pizza you see at a pizza shop type of thing, idk how to explain it. The conflicts didn't explain themselves well, the characters appear and reappear whenever they want..remember Kotoko's dad, her little crew, Keira, and Matsumoto...come on... Pretty much, the friendships in this anime are not realistic at all. It doesn't feel irl to me, like...not even a chance. when you combine trying to pull off marriage and have an interesting cast of characters..


.I know it's hard but man I think Itazura na Kiss was greatly held back and hindered by this issue. The animation was whatever, nothing great to look at for me. Music was the same, some parts nice, some parts repetitive. Um yeah..the story was rushed, therefore most of the characters where whacked up and downright boring to watch for me when the high school era subsided other than Kotoko and Irie.



TL;DR Overall I do recommend this anime for some touchy moments and some laughs, but don't expect to get a whole lot of both in one punch due to the plot development. Actually I'll recommend to most anime romance fans, heck maybe even to all romance fans, because Kotoko is just cute haha! This will get a 7 out of 10 from me.

Story: 10
The story of Itazura Na Kiss doesn't get a ten because it's an extravagant or complex story; It gets a ten for it's lovely, straightforward, and simple story line. The main appeal of the story is that it doesn't focus on one main part of life like High School life. The author takes the characters through, High School, College, careers, marriage, and even children. Getting to see this gradual move through life and it's struggles is great and entertaining. The main characters relationship is very unique so it keeps the interest up. The comedy is well rounded and fantastic at relieving more stressful moments.Overall, the best part of this is the sheer reality of the show. 


Art: 6


Unfortunately, Itazura Na Kiss is very dated and so is the art. While it was good art for it's time nowadays its okay at best. It still adheres to the old drawing where everyone looked similar with flat and boring lines.


Sound: 10


Too make up for the art the voice acting in this show is great and the actors definitely suit the characters. The emphasis is always at the right place and really adds to the show.


Character: 10


The Characters are fantastic. Kotoko is clumsy and not talented in anything, but she extremely kind and hardworking while her costar Naoki is good at everything and passionate about nothing. They balance each other perfectly and teach each other lessons. There are also incredibly lovable side characters like Kei chan the overzealous boy who constantly chases after Kotoko with the sweetest of intentions. There is Chris an american girl who falls in love with Japan. There is Naoki's extremely eccentric family including his overserious younger brother and his slightly yet enjoyably crazy mother. 


Enjoyment: 10

This anime is easy to get into and easy to love it's full of great characters with beautiful personalities that you can't help but watch over to the end.

Love should be a two-way street but this anime, Itazura na Kiss, believes that it can work on a one-way as well.
Itazura na Kiss follows Kotoko who is a very devoted high school student not to her studies but to one smart and good-looking boy named Naoki Irie. Rather than being the usual shy girl, Kotoko hands Irie a confession letter hoping that he would accept it but obviously he doesn't. So, she embarks on a journey to win Irie's heart and conveniently, a rather small earthquake destroys her home and she ends up living with Irie. 
The plot follows a very standard shoujo formula:normal girl likes really attractive guy, guy may not like girl (in Irie's case, detests Kotoko), but guy eventually warms up to the girl, and everything is rosy. What makes Itazura na Kiss stand out, in a bad sense, is the second part of the shoujo plotline: guy may not like girl. While it is interesting to see the guy abhor the girl from the start, it does not logically make sense even after their relationship deepens that Irie still despises Kotoko and that Kotoko is alright with Irie being that way. If I was Kotoko, I would leave Irie to go for a man who cares about me and understands my feelings. 


It is unfortunate that this anime is frequently brought up with Clannad: AS. Without spoiling too much, Itazura na Kiss does have a similar story trajectory as Clannad: AS but it fails to live up to the thematic elements masterfully expressed in Clannad: AS. Although I have yet to see the other anime recommended, I believe that Itazura na Kiss is unique for the way it handled the relationship between Irie and Kotoko.


There is a lively cast of characters in Itazura na Kiss. In fact, I would say that what prevented Itazura na Kiss to be an utter flop is its side characters. They lead interesting lives, come from different backgrounds, and seem to be more human than our two lead characters. 

The two leads are Kotoko and Irie. Kotoko is your usual clumsy shoujo female lead. She is very stubborn in her feelings but I am wary if such a personality is inspiring in real-life compared to the 2D screen. Ladies: if a guy doesn't like you, please don't try to force him to like you. There's a fine line drawn for how passionate you can be for someone. The main male lead is Naoki Irie and he is a very cold man. He is brilliant at his studies, but his relationship IQ is pretty darn low. He emotionally hurts Kotoko many times and although Kotoko is okay with that, I do not forgive him. Like most of the other characters in the anime, I can't quite picture what Kotoko sees in Irie.

Kotoko, like any other shoujo female lead, has her entourage of a pretty and vain girl, Satomi, and an ugly girl, Jinko. However, they get little development in the story. If they did, my ear drums would hate to hear more of Jinko's hoarse voice.

Along with that entourage is Kinnosuke, a devout lover for Kotoko. Ironically, he is portrayed as a clueless guy at the beginning but yet he eventually becomes, in my opinion, the most mature character of the entire cast. He loses Kotoko to Irie but he does not lose sight of his goal to open his own restaurant and starts a new life without Kotoko. He understands how to let go, a notion that the main characters seem to not have registered.

The other interesting side characters are: Sudou, a fervent tennis player, Nobuhiro, a boy with kidney problems, Keita, the Jacob Black of Itazura na Kiss, and Matsumoto Yuuko, an attractive and potential rival to Kotoko. Their unique stories lend the spice that made Itazura na Kiss bearable. 


Given that Itazura na Kiss was released in 2008, the art is not very pleasing to the eye if you prefer artwork from those released in 2010 and after. However, even for its time, I would say the anime's artwork is not particularly outstanding. The colours are faded and the background art seems to be lifeless. 


The soundtrack is forgettable but the second ending music was very catchy. The anime caught me by surprise when it inserted a Japanese rap song in an episode. That was very interesting but perhaps the anime needed that injection of power or else the show would fall off the map. The voice actors were solid but once again, Jinko's voice can shatter mirrors across the galaxy.


Overall, Itazura na Kiss is an alright anime if you don't look too deeply into the characters. As a fan of romance, I wouldn't rate it very highly but if you enjoy watching anime that takes the relationship beyond high school, then you will enjoy this anime. If you prefer anime with deeper and more human relationships, you may find yourself a hard time getting into Itazura na Kiss. 


Did you like the relationship between Kotoko and Irie? Let me know! I would love to hear from you!

At first I thought this was your typical Shoujo Anime. With a girl in love with a boy and in the end they live happily ever after but i was wrong. This anime is funny, stupid and cheerful. I was happy to finally see an ending for this funny shoujo anime after the mangaka died and couldn't show anyone how she would like to end it. Okay so this is the plot: Kotoko from class F (yes she is a bit stupid) falls in love with Naoki from class A. He is a bit self-centered and very very smart without even working for it. Shetries to tell him her feelings but being as cold-hearted as he is he ignores her. Because of an incident with her house and their fathers being friends of each other. She somehow comes to live in his house and is making things a bit hard for Naoki. After that his life is changing drastically in a good way and many things happen. But the rest you should really see for yourself, but i can be sure you will enjoy this anime.

Itazura na Kiss in a word: Real
One very appealing quality about this anime is that all of it is possible. It could very well be a true story. Nothing is too greatly over exaggerated. And it is in it's own way a very sweet story.
I did enjoy it, but I only gave it an overall 8 for a couple reasons.
1. All of the conflict between the leads was due to their lack of communication. One or two problems because of that is no biggie. But dang was it frustrating and annoying knowing that everything could be solved instantly if one of them was just like"Hey what's up with you doing this?" "Oh because this and this and that other thing." "Oh that makes all the sense now. Thanks babe." 


2. The main girl never grows up. This anime stretches through many years, but the lead girl still acts like a teenager even though she is around 30 years old, and the fact that she is constantly in pig-tails doesn't help either. I wish the creators would have done something to make her seem more mature because of the knowledge she has gained through having a relationship with the male lead. 


Other than those two things, it was very enjoyable.

This anime is about a girl that has the IQ of a rock trying to get the smartest guy in the school to fall in love with him. 
On the surface, this seems like an interesting story line with the not so desirable girl trying to get the guy. This might be why many people may enjoy this type of anime. 
HOWEVER,  the producers made the characters so extremely opposites that sometimes I questioned whether or not a rock was smarter than the girl. In one scene, she couldn't even read regular japanese that an elementary student could read. Her stupidness was so annoyingto watch. The guy, on the other hand, was just a smarta$$ the entire time. There is a limit to how arrogant you can be. Although I really hated the girl, I kind of felt sorry for her when he was such a jerk to her. Then again, she kind of did bad things to him, so I guess it was kind of justified. \n\n
Honestly, this is probably one of the worst romance anime I've ever seen, and the first one I've ever dropped. The entire premise of the story was too painful for me to continue.

There were a number or things I enjoyed about this anime but a few stood out. I loved how each character had there own personality  and weren't too similar . The second thing that stood was the story line. Yes I know there's stories about a girl chasing after a cold and emotionless guy but I loved how the storyline didn't have the guy fall in love with the main character so easily and quickly, I mean there were many obstacles in her path but also I liked how you got time to see how the main character was without the guy and seeher take on challenges. Last but not least I loved how this anime made me laugh. The characters were very fun and the problems and situations they faced made it even that much more interesting.

And well, Yuuki id just adorable!..well, I really like this Anime so..anyone who is reading this..hope you guys like it too!

I have seen several love comedy animes, but this one is by far the most satisfying. Not only do you get the love scenes you dream of seeing when you watch a love anime, but you also enjoy the progression towards those scenes. The plot is somewhat predictable, but it contains a large amount of surprises that one never sees in other animes. The characters have a very distinct personality, especially the main male character (Irie) whose outlook on things can never be predicted. The main protagonist is a  refreshing comical character one needs to keep a light air in the anime. While otheranimes have tiring situations where the viewer feels discouraged about whether the protagonist will succeed, this show keeps several backup characters to keep the audience's spirit high. 


A final detail that this anime especially delivers is a most satisfying ending. One is always prepared for a teary eyed ending that leaves the storyline incomplete, but this plot does not leave you hanging. It goes far enough to leave the story feeling complete and with a happy ending. It also makes sure to not have any fillers, yes, there are NO filler episodes (with the exception of a special episode at the end of the series). Each episode played a large part in making the plot be what it is.


I definitely suggest this anime to anyone who desires a filling serving of a love story that isn't too serious in dialogue, but serious enough to make the audience want to stand up and cheer for a job well done.

For the record, I'd like to start out by saying that all you idiots who are ganging up on Kotoko on her apparent masochist love she holds for Irie when you haven't even finished the series.  All you morons should finish before judging.  I can understand you disliking the series but for god's sake if you're going to bash a show at least watch it all the way through.  And to all you Kotoko haters out here, she realized: "YOU CANT HELP WHO YOU FALL IN LOVE WITH" which you guys seem to mistake for masochism.  And now to our level-headedanime lovers.  I am a person who watches anime with no expectations for the start of the show because I want to see what the anime is trying to do.  The mark of a good anime in my opinion is not necessarily a happy ending, or even a good romance; a great anime in my opinion makes you think like the characters and understand them.  Itazura na Kiss has one of the most realistic takes on romance I've seen since Cross Games.  Kotoko is the lovable but dumb, not ugly but not a stud main girl lead who always tries her hardest.  Pretty common storyline, but like a previous review stated, "It's not the end result but the journey," this phrase suits this anime perfectly.  Irie is the typical cold-hearted (sometimes vilified) OOD (object of desire) of Kotoko.  Its rare to see cold rejection turn into true love *cough cough* but InK really allows Kotoko and Irie's relationship develop into something truly amazing.  To be honest while watching this show they were the perfect couple for this reasoning.  Irie is amazing at everything but is cold and disinterested while Kotoko isnt particularly great at anything except her enthusiasm to help others and her determination.  They're a perfect match, he's the talent and she's the inspiration and drive.  Before you write this show off, give it a chance.  Oh and on a personal note the person who loved keita should suck it i hated him lol xD

I have never read the manga, mainly because I didn't like the drawings very much. The anime art was much better, and I loved the ending. They should have continued! This anime also inspired me to study medicine. Those of you which have watched it will understand why. 
If anything, I'd say the anime escalates quite quickly, thought it has to because there are only 25 episodes. They're in college one episode, andmaybe three episodes later, they'll be in the hospital. I don't think there's anything wrong with this because it is an anime about life, after all. \n

I clearly remember that after watching the Korean drama "Mischievous Kiss" I promised myself that I will never watch the anime it was adapted from. And yet, here I am, finishing the whole thing in just a day. So, for the sake of the k-culture fans who are interested in giving the original story a try, I decided to write a quick comparison between the two versions.
So, "Itazura na Kiss" has the same shallow, shoujo-ish beginning which leads to death by cheesiness. Come on now, no matter how much I try to ignore some facts, it is still clear that the debut of the seriesis by no means realistic. The drama has the same crappy start, so I guess they are a bit similar.


But after a few episodes (very shoujo-ish, I might add), the plot gets interesting. This is the first anime I have seen that actually focuses a bit on the life after marriage. That is definitely one of the reasons why you should check it out. Also, the fact that the guy is actually confessing, feeling jealousy and expressing himself (are you reading this, Kim HyunJoong-sshi? - the drama lacks a bit on his part, but he's a bishounen, so whatever), makes the storyline easier to digest. I can honestly say that the drama doesn't even try to let the plot evolve, keeping it to a merely shoujo-ish setting. So yeah, depends on your liking.


Still, the anime presents itself with a crappy image. Apart from the pretty artwork, there is this white filter or something that forces me to make weird faces as I am trying to get used to it. It might be because of the stream I used to watch it, so if that's the case, consider this comment worthless and go on.^^


I hated the male seyuu's voice. (Naoki's, of course) ^^ He reminds me a bit of Jun Fukuyama's voice in Special A, and that makes me cringe. (I really, really hate Fukuyama in Special A - and in most of his other animes, but I guess someone will be coming after me if I say that) So yeah, when it comes to voices, I would have replaced Daisuke Hirakawa with Kim HyunJoong anytime. But apart form that, everything's completely fine with me.


As a conclusion, I really enjoyed this anime. It gives off that special "something", even though it is as cheesy as a shoujo anime can be. Even though I cannot rate it higher than 8 (because seriously now, I never rated a shoujo thing higher than 8, for obvious reasons), I really enjoyed watching it. ^^

I should have known but this series is meant for the female audience. There's not much more I can say. I didn't like it that much but mainly because I was expecting something else.
The story isn't anything special. It could have turned out better but it stayed pretty normal. It's just about a girl who never gives up.
The conversations between the characters aren't that good. You can almost predict what each character is going to say because they almost never do something unexpected. I was sometimes really irritated by what the heroine said because she never stays true to her word.
The animation was annoying whenI started watching. After a while I got used to it but it still wasn't good. The faces seem deformed when viewed from other angels.\n\n
I really didn't like this series at first. It was only because I kept watching that I started to sympathise with the characters.

You may think that my overall score is too perfect to be true, but honestly i loved this anime and i don't intend to lie about how much it impressed me.
I loved Katoko and her personality. She is the sole reason why i kept watching, and it takes a really good anime for me to finish. I'm personally very picky in the animes I watch. 
Anyways, Kotoko and Irie.... I dont know how to explain it but there were real feelings in this anime. Not fake feelings and shallow acting. It touched my heart. True it takes time to get to the sole part ofthe plot, but believe me it's worth it to keep watching. And if you choose this anime to watch you won't be disappointed. I'm very sad to say that I'm quite depressed it has ended, but all in all I'm very very glad with the outcome.


SO WATCH IT GUYS. I LOVE THIS ANIME AND I WILL REWATCH IT ONE DAY.

This is my first anime review, so bear with me please! There are going to be some spoilers, just as a warning, though I'll try to keep them limited. This isn’t exactly the kind of anime you watch because you don’t know the ending, though, so I don’t feel too bad about it. :)
I’m giving Itazura na Kiss an overall score of 7/10. This is because though there are many issues within it, it still is, at its core, an earnest and heartwarming story that I believe is worth the watch if you’re interested in the shoujo genre, especially if you’re sick and tired ofseeing anime about relationships that never actually come to fruition. However, as I said, there were definite flaws that I should probably address first.\n
My biggest gripe with this anime is the pacing. The anime starts off really well; the premise is interesting, albeit unrealistic (but hey, you don’t exactly watch a shoujo for realism!).  A few episodes in, however, you start realizing that the anime occasionally jumps large gaps of time from episode to episode, or even sometimes within a single episode. It quickly becomes evident that this is done in attempt to jam pack Kotoko and Irie’s entire relationship into the 25 episode series, and it does so with limited effectiveness. These skips in time (sometimes only a few weeks, sometimes a few months, sometimes even a few years) make the plot feel unlevel and make the characters’ intentions feel misplaced. This is specifically true in Irie’s case. I honestly feel as though the true climax of the story for me is the first time Irie kisses Kotoko, because up until that point the setting has been constant (high school), and both Kotoko and Irie’s growth in emotion and confliction has been displayed. You can really tell why he kisses her and what he meant by it. It was, to me, a great platform for the series to take off. However, instead of doing just that and further developing their relationship, the time skips continue and the show begins to grow much more one-sided (primarily focusing on Kotoko’s inner troubles and never again voicing Irie’s), which makes it difficult to understand why Irie has such a change of heart when he does decide to be with Kotoko 7 someodd episodes later. It doesn’t feel natural. You can connect why Irie would want her, but you never are shown this transition in any palpable way. This, in combination with the ever-changing setting due to how jam-packed this anime is, makes the large progressions in their relationship feel a little lacking in substance; they even feel somewhat ridiculous at times. You also begin to lose sight of the roots of the relationship this way. However, this isn’t to say that the tender moments aren’t tender, because they are. It’s what makes the show altogether easily watchable. \n
The secondary characters are fine; mostly inoffensive and decent compliments to the story. One shoutout I’ll make is to Irie’s brother, Yuuki, whose role truly helped to enhance the story, despite him lacking in airtime as the show progressed. While Kotoko’s two best school friends, Jinko and Satomi, are fairly forgettable, and Jinko’s VA grates me like no other, they straight out disappear around 2/3rds of the way into the series. When I say they’re forgettable, that doesn’t mean I outright want to forget them! This is, I’m assuming, because Kotoko changes her line of study, but it was pretty jarring to me that they’re recurring characters in the series up to one point where they just stop showing up until the very end. \n
There are lots of slip-ups like this throughout the anime that annoyed me a little, but I don’t want to be too nitpicky. The character slip-ups are, however, mostly due to how much substance they attempted to cram into this show. If they had taken more time with it, most of these issues could have been remedied. \n
The music was effective, the seiyuus (apart from Jinko, though that’s more personal preference) were as well – I found Kotoko’s excited, chipper voice extremely versatile and fit for a good shoujo heroine, and Irie’s disinterested drawl definitely did the job. The OP is one of my favorite anime OPs I have heard in a long time; it’s very catchy and nostalgic. The art isn't dazzling, but isn't hard on the eyes, either.\n
And again, this anime is, at its core, sincere in its message – that intelligence isn’t all there is to a person, and that being diligent, determined, and earnest can truly pay off in the end. Kotoko’s character is a strong point in the series, though mostly due to the fact that she IS the heroine and does get the most time devoted to her and her problems. You really do see her subtly evolve yet remain ever-strong and ever-determined (a highlight for me was in episode 22, where you see her hard work academically pay off in a real-life setting). The sweet spots are definitely sweet, and are sure to leave anyone who allows the pacing problems to sit well with them aww out loud (at least I did). \n
I hope I didn’t deter anyone from watching this anime! From the slim pickings of the shoujo world, Itazura na Kiss definitely stands out as a decent choice. It doesn’t live up to the standards of Toradora or LoveCom, but it shines as an easy-watch for any lover of pure, shoujo-style romance.

After reading reviews and watching some episodes again, I have come to the conclusion I need to change my rating and review of this anime. The first time I watched it I thought it was great mostly because it was the first anime I have watched that goes beyond high school for a couple and into their marriage lives.
But now that I am older I just expect more from anime and realized this anime doesn't fully deliver.
I'm not big on taking lessons and morals from anime but the constant recurrence of Kotoko chasing a guy who at first doesn't care for her, you can't helpbut realize that the writers were trying to romanticize what is still kind of a one-sided relationship.


Since I rated the characters as a three, I'll start there. Kotoko is a dumb, clumsy yet determined girl who is in class F. I'm really under the impression she has a learning disability. She falls for "the smarts guy in possibly Japan" and tries to give him a confession that he quickly turns down.


And so thus begins her long five-year journey into winning his love.


Naoki is supposed to be some genius who is so smart that he does not have to try and put effort into anything he does. Really he is just another stereotype who is smart but is a robot and confused when it comes to emotions like love or jealousy. So as far as I am concerned, he's pretty dumb too.


And really his main characteristics that are memorable would have to be his dull personality. He's really robotic and when he does say a full sentence, it's usually an insult.


This anime is so cliche it's painful. the guys that like Kotoko are nice and the girls who like Naoki are snobby like him. And yet Naoki and Kotoko are a good match?


He treats her any kind of way and she just takes it. Then a dozen people have to show her how bad the relationship is before she gets to a breaking point but then when she does leave, she is roped back in with sweet words or his mom interferes.


It's not a totally horrible anime, but it's not an anime to watch if you are looking for chemistry and actual romance. This anime kind of borders along the emotional abuse line.

In total I've watched all twenty-six episodes twice. Both times I loved it!! I would definitely recommend this to all of my friends!!

I thought I was going to hate this anime when I first started. I never thought I would finish the whole series and I never thought that I would enjoy it as much as I did.  I was so frustrated by how rude Naoki was and how dumb and useless they made Kotoko seem (though she was likable throughout). As someone who really values deep, thoughtful characters, I was very skeptical.  I think it was the second season that totally changed my mind.  When they started taking the relationship to the next level, I found myself really enjoying seeing how the twoprogressed together and was impressed by the amount of character development seen in both mains.  As soon as they gave Kotoko a dream other than to be with Naoki, I found myself really enjoying the anime.  I loved how both characters evolved and we came to appreciate both sets of strengths and weaknesses.I loved where they went with the story and I thought the ending was super satisfying. \n\n
 The music wasn't mesmerizing and the art wasn't like exceptionally gorgeous (though, of course, it was still very nice), but the anime was really fun.  If you're feeling down and need a fun, light-hearted pick-me-up romantic anime to watch, Itazura na Kiss is your anime.  Definitely recommend.

I have no idea how many times i tried to watch it. The first seconds were so boring and stupid that I automatically close the player's window. But when I finally had the courage to see more, I regreat it.

This amazing anime was aired almost  6 years ago and here I am, in the year 2014, still being stunned by how amazing it really was. The amount of emotions and character development just doesnt stop. There is hardly any cliff hangers which forces you to watch the next episode, no no no my friend, I continued watching purely because I just wanted more. Now, onto the review
Story: 
Many viewers would probably judge this anime by its cover; a typical Shoujo and predictable. In a way, it kinda does, nevertheless, the story remained pure and innocent from start to finish. The concept of growingup and innocent love is just so beautifully portrayed. Not only does the story start from a simple high school crushes, the story continues further into the future, you really get to know the characters and the amount of emotions put into every scene. Another thing which was very well done was the pace of the story. What some viewers must understand is that this anime takes place in a matter of years, unlike other shows where the whole season was only.. say.. 1 school year. The events which takes place in the story and the emotional reactions was just so beautifully constructed and REAL. This story, didnt focus on any love triangle madness like other Shoujos, this one really focused on their bonding and self-fulfillment. And nevertheless, the ending was satisfying, no loose ends, even supporting characters gets their own closure :3 This is the type of storyline that I personally, speaking from someone from 6 years following the airing of this anime, is always seeking in todays mixed society. A nice, mellow, and smooth storyline 


Art and Sound: 

For its time, The art and drawings were well constructed. The backgrounds were beautiful. Im no art person but it was pleasant to watch :3 As for the sound and music. The OP and ED really set the mood. 


Characters: 

Oh My Lord, there is a mix of characters which just makes this show so enjoyable and wonderful! To start of, Kotoko. At first impression, She made herself out to be quite annoying and persistent and someone clueless on her surroundings but nevertheless, she was always so passionate and caring for the people around her. She was so entertaining to watch. and to see such character development in her just really made her pairing with Naoki more enjoyable to watch. Naoki was somewhat predictable but nevertheless, he really filled the void. His 'cold-heart' behavior just made all the sweet moments worthwhile. What i loved about this anime is that none of the characters  (except 1) was annoying. Even the rivals, strangely. You just cant help but love them all.. especially the Mum :P 


Enjoyment: 

OH, believe me, I enjoyed this anime to the NEXT level. I with they would make more stories like this. This kind of anime really was somewhat of a relaxing anime and something somewhat different. No love triangle mess, just pure love and journey of the characters hopes, goals and dreams. I will definitely will not forget this anime for a long long time.
